Reiner Lemoine Institute

short description: our team investigates hydrogen mobility and others based on renewable energies. A major challenge for this pioneering technology is the so-called "chicken-egg problem". A lack of infrastructure inhibits the acquisition of hydrogen vehicles while, at the same time the development of infrastructure by the missing demand is not economically viable. Your task is to evaluate the modular use of low-cost electrolysis systems with low power. To do this, you will simulate the gradual retrofit of the systems to meet a rising over time hydrogen needs in MATLAB and evaluate the results within the framework of a feasibility study. It should be checked whether the comparatively an incentive can create lower initial investment costs for the development of the hydrogen infrastructure. Prerequisites: You should have customized experience in scientific work and already have at least a more extensive work. Ideally, are student/student of mechanical engineering, energy engineering, vehicle technology or an other relevant discipline and have an excellent understanding. It gives you no trouble to work quickly in complex issues. Experience and knowledge in dealing with MATLAB, as well as knowledge of the economic calculation be preferred. We assume an independent, systematic and careful way of working, as well as the ability to communication and documentation of the work results. Contact: Please send your application with full CV via E-Mail and telephone queries to the specified contact.

It's qualifying places in the sense of science time contract law (WissZeitVG), intended to promote the scientific qualification of employees / employees. The GRK 2158, funded by the German research community deals with the fundamental question of how tumors or human pathogenic micro-organisms, which have become resistant to currently available cytostatics or antibiotics, can be controlled by new resistance-breaking anti-tumor drugs or antibiotics. Resistance mechanisms show functional similarities of tumors and microbial pathogens. Therefore, a combined study of anti-tumour and anti-microbial activities may lead to a scientific added value, especially since micro-organisms often serve as model system for more complex eukaryotic cells. Natural products and analogues derived from stress-exposed and little studied marine organisms and Endophytes will serve as a starting point for the identification of new lead structures. The subsequent functional characterization of these control structures is intended to provide information on the underlying active and resistance mechanisms. We are looking for talented and highly motivated candidates with a master's or Staatsexamen degree in pharmacy, biology, chemistry, biochemistry or a related discipline. Detailed information on the individual projects, the application process and the required application forms and qualification program can be found at http://www.grk2158.hhu.de.

We seek a talented, dynamic, highly motivated young scientist to join our department for Biological Mechanisms of Ageing, ( http://www.age.mpg.de/science/research-labs/partridge ) headed by Director Prof. Linda Partridge. We are interested in applicants with a background in mouse biology and/or high-throughput data analysis. The successful candidate will join an enthusiastic and collaborative team in an excellent scientific environment. The department investigates mechanisms of ageing and ageing-associated diseases, using the fruit fly Drosophila and the mouse as experimental model organisms. Our work combines in vivo phenotyping with high-throughput techniques (proteomics, metabolomics, RNA-Seq, Bisulfite-Seq), molecular biology, biochemistry and high-resolution imaging to study how pharmacological, dietary and genetic interventions extend health and lifespan in mice. The post is available from the earliest time point. The Max Planck Institute for Biology of Ageing was founded in 2008 for the purpose of understanding fundamental mechanisms of healthy ageing. It is part of a broad network of research institutions in the Cologne-Bonn area dedicated to research on ageing and age-related disease, including the CECAD Cluster of Excellent in the University of Cologne, constituting a vibrant and collaborative environment for research. Equipped with state-of-the-art technology and excellent core facilities, to which the successful candidate would have access, the institute provides outstanding research opportunities for its scientists. At the moment, we host employees from 34 different nations. The successful candidate will hold a master‘s degree/diploma in biology, molecular biology, biochemistry or a related field. The applicant should have strong written and oral communication skills. The working language is English; knowledge of the German language is not required. Experience in one of the following methodologies: in vivo mouse phenotyping, genetics, epigenetics, pharmacology, high-throughput data analysis is an advantage. and should be uploaded using our application website http://www.age.mpg.de/career/open-positions/ until 6 November 2016. The employment contract is based on contracts for the civil service (TVöD-Bund, Tarifvertrag für den öffentlichen Dienst) and will be time limited. The successful candidate will hold a master‘s degree/diploma in biology, molecular biology, biochemistry or a related field. The applicant should have strong written and oral communication skills. The working language is English; knowledge of the German language is not required. Experience in one of the following methodologies: in vivomouse phenotyping, genetics, epigenetics, pharmacology, high-throughput data analysis is an advantage. and should be uploaded using our application website http://www.age.mpg.de/career/open-positions/ until 6 November 2016. We offer a three-year contract according to the funding guidelines for young researchers of the Max Planck Society. Informal enquiries are welcome and should be sent to lpartridge@age.mpg.de . For further information about the Institute see www.age.mpg.de The Max Planck Society is committed to employ more disabled individuals and especially encourages them to apply. The Max Planck Society seeks to increase the number of women in those areas where they are underrepresented and especially encourages them to apply.

格罗宁根、 Broerstraat 5 教授、 副教授、 助理教授和讲师的行为和社会 38.0 小时每周最高欧元 5330 大学研究生 216286 格罗宁根大学助理教授位置坐落在教育科学部 / 格罗宁根研究所教育研究祗 （园）。这个部门负责教学学士和硕士一级。在学士一级，这包括学士教育科学和学术学士为小学教师、 新闻部的联合方案和三个高等教育研究所。在主一级，这包括硕士教育科学包括国际轨道 '循证教育' 和行为与社会科学研究的大师。部内对学习环境的证据为基础的教育，学校的成功，和创新和公民身份的决定因素进行了研究。该位置包括研究、 教学和组织及管理任务。助理教授，将有助于研究领域的学习与教学重点放在儿童早期教育。研究包括 50%的位置，这包括博士生的监督。位置包括 50%的各类的学士和硕士课程 （例如，讲座、 研讨会、 实习、 论文和协调） 的教学与学习及指令和循证教育重点。管理任务涉及主轨道证据基于教育的协调。被任命者应满足以下最低要求为助理教授 (UD) 制定的教师任期轨道政策︰ 格罗宁根大学提供工资根据学历和工作经验。助理教授一级的工资为全职职位的候选人范围从最低 € 3,427 （工资规模 11 荷兰大学） 到 € 5,330 （薪金表 12） 最多每月毛。薪金毛额不包括假期津贴，8%和 8.3%的年底奖金和雇员退休金计划的参与。有利的税收协定可能适用于非荷兰申请者。你将任命为固定期六年过去了，积极的中期评价的第三年的就业条件 （请注意，是否你有一个先前的约会在格罗宁根大学，就业的长度可能更受法律的约束）。后积极的最后评价就业第六年，你将会予任职副教授。申请人劝谕咨询任期轨道系统的标准，请参阅︰ www.rug.nl/gmw/research/tenure-track-notitie-gmw-2015-door-cvb-goedgekeurd-uk-0508.pdf 雇佣条件的详细概述，请访问︰ www.rug.nl/about-us/work-with-us/that-is-why/conditions-employment 的位置是全职 (1.0 fte)。预约 0.8 fte 是可能的。我们期待的人选，尽快启动。请发送你完整的应用程序 （用英语） 为单个 PDF 文件直到 10 月 20 日 / 2016 年 10 月 21 日 （荷兰当地时间），应用程序窗体 （单击应用下面和广告上大学网站上）。请上传您的应用程序作为 '动机信'，包括空缺编号在您的应用程序开始。1.求职信包括你对你研究和 （或） 教学可能如何融入 2 部的看法。最新的简历包括科学出版物 3 的列表。你的研究成果和今后的研究目标 4 的简短声明。样你研究 （发表的论文或论文审查） 复印件 5。姓名和联系方式的两个学术引用。未经请求的营销不是理解。72 个月格罗宁根大学教师的行为和社会科学由于其基础在 1614 年，荷兰格罗宁根大学已享有国际声誉作为一个充满活力和创意的中心的高等教育提供高质量的教学和研究。平衡中种类繁多的学科研究和职业生涯路径鼓励发展自己个人的天赋的 30000 名学生和研究人员。属于欧洲和加入部队与声望伙伴大学和网络最好的研究型大学，格罗宁根大学是知识的真正国际的地方。教师行为和社会科学是知识的专注于个人和社会中心。教师作为一个整体研究问题与有关的人类行为，人与社会之间的关系。这包括研究的人在正常情况下的作用，但也遇到的个人或团体，和可以如何解决或预防这些问题。教授 R.J.斯克，+ 31 50 3636631 （成功秘诀）

单元慕尼黑是欧洲 最强的研究型大学 之一。在大学学科的多样性提供了所有学术领域的创新研究。作为知识的一个组成部分，文化和经济大都市的慕尼黑单元提供最佳的基础设施，其学者和科学家的基础研究到技术转让面向应用的研究。作为在德国和欧洲领先的研究型大学之一，我们想要吸引优秀的科学家和科学家在所有职业生涯阶段，并促进新的研究思路。年轻的科学家和学者的创造性的智慧是不可缺少的面向未来的大学。因此，我们创造了良好的研究和资格条件的博士研究生。我们提供可靠的职业发展机会为年轻科学家和科学家 — — 例如在博士后阶段或通过我们的任期轨道模型，我们成功地实施有针对性的促进优惠长

单元慕尼黑是最成功的大学在卓越的德国竞争︰ 在卓越倡议第二阶段，其结果揭晓 2012 年 6 月，是所有应用程序的单元 -四毕业学校 四个群集的卓越 和 体制战略 LMUexcellent- 批准。已经在德国范围内的第一轮竞争加强大学研究单元慕尼黑在所有三行的资金是成功.

有事。这个地方是最初限于 31.12.2018。如何将互联网的未来看起来像？什么知名类型的通信将被保留，新必须要考虑的另外？什么更多的挑战表示网络的日益移动使用？概括起来︰ 面临的挑战是一个日益增长的活力和变化的条件，形式越来越多样的使用稳步上升的质量标准和各种协议简单使用范围。迎接这项挑战，会在协作研究中心 SFB 资助由德国研究基金会 DFG 1053"MAKI-多机制适应未来互联网"< www.maki.tu-darmstadt.de > 探索通信系统及其适应、 互动和不断优化和长期发展的机制。目前 14 教授/教授在三个不同学科的研究领域，以及超过 25 科学员工，加上相关研究者/科学家、 约 50 名学生和其他大学的一些著名学者/科学家参与合作研究的中心。在框架内的协作研究中心，是负责所有任务的协作的组织协调和发言人的特别研究领域和其他机构的协同工作。你创建、 监测和控制的内部流程，定期的项目会议和资金的使用和所有研究人员/科学家参与协作研究中心作为日人次联系中心联系。它还与紧密合作在达姆施塔特的土行政通信和多媒体领域的技术员工承担秘书处、 财务、 活动组织、 外部表示，和系统管理方面的任务。你是负责报告和协调继续应用程序的创建。你必须总是考虑协作研究中心作为基地的实质内容和积极塑造。如果你有兴趣的话你可以作为一个博士后除了独立科学工作领域的互联网通信，特别自组织系统，覆盖通信或相关的领域。你是在 COM < www.kom.tu-darmstadt.de > 多媒体通信领域的参与。达姆施塔特的土是德国领先技术大学之一。除了良好的学习条件也提供优秀的环境的研究与教学，达姆施塔特的土。特别研究领域被为首教授斯坦梅茨作为演讲者。教授斯坦梅茨还管理多媒体通信部。提供也是申请人的服务的科学资格原籍。将有机会准备矿山投资。达姆施塔特的技术大学目的在增加妇女工作人员所占比例，鼓励特别是妇女，申请。申请人或申请人的至少 50 或相当于残疾程度是首选在平等健身。根据集体协议为达姆施塔特技术大学 （电视-土达姆施塔特） 报酬。非全日制用工是可能的。我们期待收到您信息的应用程序组成的一封信在那里你解释你感兴趣的任务，应用和转到你的长处和兴趣，简历和证书和引用的副本。请寄给我们你完整的应用程序可能进入该日期的说明或者通过邮寄或电子邮件 （最好是在 PDF 格式） 到︰ 达姆施塔特技术大学，发言人特别研究领域 1053-MAKI，教授、 博士-ing。 拉尔夫 · 斯坦梅茨，圆塔海峡 10，64283 达姆施塔特，电子邮件︰ sprecher@maki.tu-darmstadt.de

Job description Application, salary, etc.
  • Detailed CV.
  • Certificates/Diplomas (Master and PhD degree).
  • Teaching portfolio (please see below).
  • Complete list of publications, indicating which publications are most relevant for the position.
  • Up to 10 of the most relevant publications. Please upload a pdf for each publication.
  • If the publication has been co-authored, co-author statements must be a part of this pdf and must include information like in this example. The statement is just for your inspiration.
  • Documented experience with research leadership.
  • Research and publication plan for the next 3 years.
  • References.

The Department of Marketing & Management invites applications for one or more positions as Professor with Specific Responsibilities in Strategic Organization Design. The positions are located in Odense and are vacant from 1 March 2017 or soon after. The professorship is time-limited to a period of 5 years with the possibility of extension. The main responsibilities will focus on research and development tasks. Research in Strategic Organization Design is focused on the academic fields of strategy and organization science. Our agenda addresses important and interesting unsolved research questions such as: 1) The aggregation problem: How do micro-processes influence the macrobehavior of organizations? 2) The adaptation problem: How does multi-level adaptation enable organizations to succeed in dynamic environments? 3) The strategic design problem: Which design rules and which schemes of adaptation generate superior performance? 4) The heterogeneity problem: What are the sources of heterogeneity in populations of business organizations? We are looking for candidates with the potential to decisively add to this research agenda. Successful candidates will have an international profile and a strong record of research publications in globally top-ranked journals, preferably in journals such as Academy of Management Review, Administrative Science Quarterly, Manage­ment Science, Organization Science, or Strategic Manage­ment Journal. If the can­didates have not published in top-ranked journals, they should have demonstrated a willingness to aim for the most recognized academic outlets internationally, and have a strategy where such aims are realistically planned for and realizable within the next few years. Also, successful candidates will have substantial teaching experience in relevant areas. The candidates must document pedagogical qualifications and compe­ten­ces at development and innovation in the pedagogical domain. We expect the successful applicants to actively engage in the development of the research unit as well as contribute positively to the Department as a whole. As senior scholars, candidates are expected to contribute actively to the social and academic lives at the department as well as participate in the guidance of doctoral students and junior faculty. Also, we expect active and constructive participation in the university's academic administration. To fulfill the requirements of the position, the candidates chosen are expected to be physically present on a regular basis. Beyond the research publication record and the teaching experiences, the candi­date will have a record of academic and scholarly leadership. The candidate must be capable of providing dynamic leadership in the development of research and teaching, in securing external research funding, and in establishing strong ties with the international research community. The candidate should have a Ph.D. degree within the mentioned research area and will be expected to teach and instruct students who participate in bachelor and master courses in business strategy and organization theory. Owing to the increasingly international focus of the degree programs, applicants must demonstrate ability to teach in English. If the successful applicant is not fluent in Danish, he or she will be expected to learn Danish within a period of approximately two years. Research within the Department is anchored in an understanding of the cooperation between markets, organizations and individuals. It encompasses a variety of areas from evolutionary models of organization to new exotic forms of consumption. It is the ambition of the Department to be in the international frontline in these areas and to seek synergy between research, teaching and knowledge dissemination. Research at the Department is organized in five research units. See the SOD website http://www.sod-research.com and the Department website http://www.sdu.dk/en/Om_SDU/Institutter_centre/I_marketing.aspx for more details. For further information, please contact Professor Thorbjørn Knudsen, telephone: +45 65503148 or email: tok@sam.sdu.dk or Head of Department Jeanette Lemmergaard, email: jla@sam.sdu.dk Appointment to the position will be in accordance with the salary agreement between the Ministry of Finance and the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. An application must include: All non-Danish documents must be translated into English. Applicants applying for a professorship are requested to submit a teaching portfolio with the application as documentation for teaching experience as well as supervi­sion qualifications. Formal application instructions and a guide for the teaching portfolio may be found here Applications will be assessed by an assessment committee. The committee may request additional information, and if so, it is the responsibility of the applicant to provide the necessary material. When the assessment committee has submitted its report, the applicant will receive the part of the evaluation that concerns him/her. Applications that are incomplete with regard to the above requirements will not be assessed by the committee. The University encourages all interested persons to apply, regardless of age, gender, religious affiliation or ethnic background. As part of the overall assessment of the applicant’s qualifications, an interview may be applied. Uploaded files must be in Adobe PDF (unlocked) or Word format. Each field can only contain a single file of max. 10 Mb. You can only apply for the position through our website Your application must be registered in our system on the 31/10/2016 at 23.59.59 CET at the latest.

Georg-August-Universität Göttingen

the Georg-August-Universität Göttingen was founded in 1737 and is an internationally significant research University, which attaches great importance to a research-based teaching. At the thirteen faculties, more than 29,000 students are enrolled, of which come just under 11 percent from abroad. It is to show the international attraction, which traditionally holds the University together with the high proportion of international scientists. The courses on offer is characterized by excellent study conditions, as well as a variety of subjects in the humanities and social sciences represented only at a few universities in Germany. The Georgia Augusta is as part of the Göttingen campus closely with an outstanding non-university research environment associated.

at the Centre for modern Indian studies of the Georg-August-Universität Göttingen is to the 15.01.2017 the site of a scientific assistant / scientific employee in the framework of the DFG priority program "aesthetic giddiness: time and representation in polychrome modernity" to fill with 75 per cent of the average regular weekly working hours (zzt. 29.85 hours / week) for a period of three years. Fee payment 13 TV-L to pay grade. Among the tasks in addition to working on a research project with the working title "religious times, media genres, technical implementation: an ethnographic study of audiovisual media practices among Shiites in Hyderabad" participation in the interdisciplinary research group on media and publics at the CeMIS. For more information about the CeMIS is available under the following link: https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/131257.html for more information about the focus program are available at the following link: http://www.aesthetische-eigenzeiten.de/ the applicant should bring with following qualifications: - a particularly qualified promotion or a particularly qualified M.A.. degree in the fields of Ethnology, sociology, South Asian studies, or related disciplines - the readiness for participation in the DFG project and in the interdisciplinary research group on media and publics in CeMIS - are fluency in Urdu/Hindustani advantageous place to the qualification of the Academics are used and offers the possibility of promotion or habilitation. The University of Göttingen seeks an increase in the percentage of women in areas where women are under-represented, and urges therefore qualified women to apply. It also sees itself as a family-friendly University and promotes science/work-family balance. The University has to set the goal, more severely disabled people to employment. Severely disabled applications get priority with the same qualifications. Please send your application with the usual documentation (cover letter, curriculum vitae, sample or magazine articles) up to the 07.11.2016 grouped together in a PDF file by E-Mail to patrick.eisenlohr@cemis.uni-goettingen.de. Peer-reviewed publications have a high priority in the selection process. Please direct any questions to Mr. Prof. Patrick Eisenlohr (email: patrick.eisenlohr@cemis.uni-goettingen.de). For more information on the website of Professor Eisenlohr http://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/356233.html.

，联邦基金邀请有前途职业生涯中期的专业人员 — — 政府的决策者、 学术研究人员、 临床领导人、 高级医院和保险经理和记者 — — 从德国申请一个独特的机会，在美国具有领先的专家研究卫生保健服务系统改革工作达 12 个月的时间里和在德国和美国的卫生政策议程上的关键问题。进一步丰富程序，英联邦基金汇集了研究员的完整的类 — — 来自澳大利亚、 加拿大、 法国、 德国、 荷兰、 新西兰、 挪威和英国 — — 在整个一年参加一系列的高层次的政策简报和领导研讨会与卫生保健的领导人。每个奖学金提供到美国 $130,000 的支持，其中包括向美国，生活津贴，与项目相关的往返机票旅行，旅行奖学金研讨会、 健康保险和美国联邦和州税。一个家庭的补充 (即，大约 60,000 美元的伙伴和两个孩子 18 岁) 还向盖机票、 生活津贴和医疗保险。有关资格、 项目或应用程序进程的详细信息，请访问 www.commonwealthfund.org/fellowships，联邦基金是一家私人基金会，成立于 1918 年，总部设在纽约，旨在促进高表演的卫生保健系统，达到更好的机会、 改进的质量和更高的效率，特别是对社会最脆弱的环节。

工作领域︰

德国柏林工业大学旨在加强研究和教学领域的"收敛访问控制网络"。研究的重点是分析和体系结构、 方法和算法在收敛接入网的发展和评价的技术和经济方面的影响。发达的体系结构应管理和连接不同的访问资源基于当前的通信方案的要求。异构网络访问的复杂性就是设计用抽象的方式和因而透明的最终用户。创新知识和领域的自组织的网络、 认知无线电和网络功能虚拟化，以及利用现代用户设备的技术功能的结果预计.< br / > < br / > 成功的候选人将有助于在研究程序中提供的教师课程。

FZI Research Center computer science

the project "Digital spaces" of the research campus Mobility2Grid (M2G) explores the communication as a key factor for the convergence of energy and mobility system: M2G means that two systems are related so far largely separated: energy and mobility. The interaction between vehicle and energy network requires that information is exchanged between the systems. As this communication of different systems with users and users at different levels is organized, is the central research question for all partners in the TF6. The FZI developed a M2G-platform with tool set with its partners for further developments to the structured and privacy-compliant collection, storage and processing of data for evaluation, analysis, forecasts, etc. For this purpose we are looking for a person who supports us in the collection and presentation of requirements and of the current state of the art.

WEIGHTLOSS · · Development of the front-ends of M2G platform · · Support for the connection of the front end and the middleware · · Research work in the field of Web and platform development (implementation, concepts, business models, etc.) · · Support for the development and evaluation of applications WE OFFER · · Ways to implement own concepts and ideas · · an interdisciplinary working environment with partners from science, industry and users · · flexible working hours and constructive cooperation · · pleasant working atmosphere, centrally located on the Friedrichstraße, Berlin WE EXPECT · · at least basic knowledge in Web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) · · Interest in the topics: Web technologies, platform development · · independent thinking and working · · Bachelor of computer science, Business Informatics or a comparable course · · very good German or English · · required courses: (economic or media -) computer science, industrial engineering, and other REQUIRED DOCUMENTS · · current grade transcript, resume · · Overview of courses visited · · any testimonials from previous projects LEARN more · · Start: starting immediately · · Size: 20-40 hours per month · · Place in the FZI-Außenstelle Berlin (www.fzi.de/berlin)

在数学研究所和图像计算的吕贝克大学是一个地方的填补很快。点是 BMBF 研究项目"动态医学影像︰ 改进的诊断、 监测、 和药物开发 (MED4D) 的医疗数据的建模与分析"关联和最初局限于 2019 年 11 月 30 日。 MED4D 是动态成像中的波鸿、 吕贝克、 明斯特大学的合作项目。目标是 4 D 医疗成像数据分析的数学模型的研究与发展。具体而言，它涉及到运动校正模型和动力学和他们遣返的临床相关参数的描述。我们期望在数学或相关的专业博士学位及强大的背景图像处理微分方程、 优化或数学建模，普通和局部地区。您的项目中的任务包括分析和执行参数化动态模型和运动模型和其耦合。此外，您将收到的可能性来区分他们自己领域的教学和资格工作监督。它预计在国际水平上的活泼出版物性能。图像计算与数学研究所在医学图像处理领域的处理数学问题 （优化、 变分法、 偏微分方程），从而提供理想的研究环境。此外，还与夫琅和费 MEVIS 研究所是关联到吕贝克。这个特殊的组合提供了极好的机会，为国际和区域合作。在友好和开放的工作环境中，你在我们找到一个非常精良的技术基础设施，以及优秀的专业和个人设计和发展的可能性。Jan Modersitzki 先生，电话 + 49 451 3101 回答这个位置类似 6100。分类是根据关税关税条件支付等级 14 的集体协议为公共服务的国家 (电视-L) 自动进行的。我们保留到最后一份工作评价的权利。大学是致力于严重残疾人士的就业。因此，喜欢被视为严重残疾的申请人与适当的适宜性。学院致力于在大学里的男性和女性雇员之间取得平衡。妇女被视为一个优先事项在等效的适宜性、 能力和专业性能。照片/应用程序照片的简报，我们明确放弃并且问这句。具体来说，我们也欢迎具有移民背景的人适用。写常用文件的应用程序正在请求不迟于 （收件箱） 数下︰

Reference number:

 IV-443/16 (starting at 01/04/17 / for a period of 3 years; an extension of 3 more years is possible after successful evaluation / closing date for applications 13/10/16)

Working field:

The TU Berlin aims to strengthen the research and teaching in the area of "Control of Convergent Access Networks". Focus of research is the analysis and development of architectures, methods, and algorithms in convergent access networks and evaluation of technological and economical implications. The developed architectures should manage and connect different access resources based on the demands of the current communication scenario. The complexity of the heterogeneous network access has to be designed in an abstract manner and thus transparent for the end user. Innovative knowledge and results in the areas of self-organized networks, cognitive radio and network function virtualization as well as utilization of technological features of modern user devices are expected.

The successful candidate is expected to contribute to the curriculum in the study programs provided by the faculty.

Requirements:



  • Knowledge of existing access technologies (FTTx, LTE-A, 5G, WiFi, LiFi etc).
  • Protocols and algorithms for traffic management and resource control.
  • Self-organizing networks and heterogeneous networks.
  • Systematic evaluation of technological features for different access technologies.
  • Simulation and modeling of algorithm and protocol behavior in convergent carrier networks.
  • Activity in relevant standardization bodies such as IETF, BBF, 3GPP.
  • Teaching experience.
13/10/2016 reference number Dekan der Fakultät IV, Sekr. MAR 6-1, Marchstraße 23, 10587 Berlin or by email to

The junior professorship is to be funded in the context of the Einstein Center Digital Future. The professorship is offered under the reserve that funds are granted. Successful applicants must fulfill the requirements for appointment at the professor level in compliance with § 102a BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act), including a completed academic education in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematics or similar, qualified achievements in research and a particular qualification for academic work normally attested by the excellent quality of a PhD, and pedagogical didactic qualifications, to be proven by teaching experience and visualized in a teaching portfolio (for further information see TUB Website , quick as no. 144242). Profound knowledge and experience are expected in several of the following themes: Additionally the applicants need to have profound knowledge in the stated working fields, experience in international research cooperations (proven by stays abroad or significant participation in international projects). Technische Universität Berlin strives to increase the proportion of women in research and teaching and therefore strongly encourages qualified female researchers to apply. Qualified individuals with disabilities will be favored. Technische Universität Berlin is a certified family-friendly higher education institution, and our Dual Career Service offers assistance to you and your family when relocating to Berlin. Please send your written application until with the and the usual documents (including a list of up to 5 publications and teaching experience, copies of relevant certificates and documents) and a description of the teaching portfolio to Technische Universität Berlin - Der Präsident -, Please send copies only. Original documents will not be returned. The vacancy is also available on the internet at

吟游诗人学院柏林

吟游诗人学院柏林希望任命经济学教授 （W2/助理教授级） 从 2017 年 9 月开始。成功的候选人将内跨学科文科坝方案的增长经济学部分创新，适应能力强的老师。学士学位的目的是教育知情的公民能够进行批判与纪律的辩论和政策问题，并成为领导人的创业、 社区和政府的倡议。考生应应用的 microeconomists。公共选择和/或公共经济学和公共财政或环境经济学的研究重点将成为一种优势，将愿意教本科生的课程，在这些领域和微观经济学、 博弈论或计量经济学中的能力。教学工作量，组成的小集团研讨会课程是 10 慢波结构或 2/3 的隐忧。教学语言是英语。最初的合约将延长四年 （在德国 W2 薪级表） 和位置将终身后成功的评价。入职条件受 §100 的柏林大学法律 (柏林 Hochschulgesetz)。申请人应具备博士学位，优秀的国际记录，在教学和研究，对文科教育和跨学科对话的兴趣超出了他们的专业化领域。应用程序应包括动机信，一份简历，包括出版物、 教学评价、 当前和未来的研究方向，在一份声明和 3 出版物的列表。候选人还要求提供他们的教学经验到目前为止 （水平的课程和学生和采取的办法），他们会教经济学的文科教育框架内的简短说明。请将这些文档通过电子邮件发送到 Izabela Westphalen: i.westphalen@berlin.bard.edu 审查的申请将在 2016 年 11 月 11 日之后开始并继续直到职位招满。巴德学院柏林是提供均等机会的雇主。为进一步非正式询问位置请参阅 www.berlin.bard.edu 或联系搜索委员会，博士教授马丁粘结剂 (m.binder@berlin.bard.edu) 的主席。

We operate polar and marine research in a broad multidisciplinary approach and thereby make an important contribution to the global environment, Earth system and Paleoclimatology in cooperation with numerous University and non-university research institutions. For our "Meteorology of the polar regions" section we are looking for an n to the 01 March 2017 currently observed climate changes in the Arctic the ice-albedo feedback plays an important role. This is influenced among other things by melt water ponds formed on the sea ice in the summer. How big is the influence of melt ponds, depends on thickness of ice, including in particular by their land coverage and their depth. In the context of work, physical properties to are determined by melting pools from existing aircraft data. Complementary ground-based in situ measurements on the sea ice, as well as measurements of a helicopter are planned, in which the doctoral student is involved. The data analysis is based on techniques of image processing and special algorithms, which should be further developed and optimized in the context of the evaluation. The overall record is used / the doctor Andenin / in as the basis to determine the spatial variability and temporal development of melting pool characteristics in the Arctic. (Get more substantive information to the site, at gerit.birnbaum@awi.de), and wolfgang.dierking@awi.de). The site is limited to 3 years. The EBS Universität für Wirtschaft und Recht (EBS) is a private, state-approved university with two faculties: the EBS Business School and the EBS Law School. The EBS University provides a broad programme spectrum in the fields of vocational and professional development. The EBS University is entitled to confer both doctoral and postdoctoral degrees. In addition to research and teaching, EBS’s most distinguishing feature is its internationality, social commitment and a strong network of corporate partners and alumni.



EBS Universität für Wirtschaft und Recht Anke.bandorski@ebs.edu

Date of announcement: September 2016

EBS Universität für Wirtschaft und Recht is looking from January 2017 for an The EBS University invites applications for a full-time Assistant Professor Position at the Real Estate Management Institute (REMI). The institute offers full-time Master in Real Estate and part-time M.A. in Real Estate programs, as well as Real Estate specialization in the BSc program. All of our degree-programs are taught in English. In addition there is a wide range of executive education certificate programs taught in German and we also have an active group of doctoral students focusing on Real Estate. EBS University is EQUIS and FIBAA accredited and our real estate programs are also RICS accredited. We have been ranked among the top European business school by the Financial Times and our MSc in Real Estate has achieved rank 3 in the world-wide Eduniversal ranking. We strive to keep our international recognition and are strongly committed to excellence in both teaching and research. The successful candidates must possess a doctoral degree in an appropriate discipline or have attained one by the time of appointment, as well as a strong potential for scholarly research, good teaching skills and a willingness to actively participate in the growing Real Estate programs at REMI. The new faculty member will teach a variety of basic and advanced real estate courses, especially in the area of real estate finance and will be expected to be involved in supervision of doctoral dissertations. Ability to teach in the executive education programs, as well as willingness to interact with our industry-network is desired. For further information concerning this position you may contact Prof. Mutl at jan.mutl@ebs.edu Please send your written application, quoting the reference number 09/16, (preferably via e-mail) to: Anke Bandorski Gustav-Stresemann-Ring 3 65189 Wiesbaden Telefon: +49 611 7102 1228

Faculty/department

Level

Maximum employment

Duration of contract

Salary scale Architecture & the Built Environment Job description Requirements Conditions of employment Information and application

Architecture & the Built Environment PhD degree Maximum of 38 hours per week (1 FTE) Tenure track with possibility of advancement €3427 to €4691 per month gross Since its foundation 110 years ago, the Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment has built up a solid international reputation for training architects, urban planners and designers, as well as for its research portfolio and coaching of PhD candidates. With around 2600 students and 500 staff members, with around 230 FTEs devoted to academic positions, our faculty is one of the largest of Delft University of Technology and one of the most prestigious architecture and the built environment faculties globally. Traditionally, the faculty has prioritised high-quality training in design and research in the field of the built environment. Over 40 chairs cover a wide range of academic areas in design, process and technology, which together cover the entire field of the built environment. The faculty has a budget of around €38 million, of which approximately €7 million is sourced indirectly and from contracts with third parties. The Faculty of Architecture and the Built Environment at Delft University of Technology has five departments: Architecture, Architectural Engineering + Technology, OTB, Urbanism, and Real Estate and Housing. The De­partment of Architecture provides education and conducts research at an internationally competitive level of excellence in the fields of architecture and architectural design. The Chair of History of Architecture and Urban Planning in the Department of Architecture is offering a tenure-track position at the level of Assistant Professor. The Chair of History of Architecture and Urban Planning works closely with other departments within the faculty and holds a key position in the interdisciplinary Design and History research programme. The committee is particularly interested in an Assistant Professor who will complement and built upon the expertise of the current members of the chair, notably in Dutch and European architectural and urban history, while also participating in collective research activities. The new faculty member will be able to take on a leading role in the development of a research project. The Assistant Professor will work across international borders and acknowledge the importance of networks and flows of architecture and their impact on built and urban form. The quality of research will be competitive on the level of European research programmes. The Assistant Professor will teach classes in the fundamental courses in the Bachelor programme (in Dutch or English) on the long-term development of architectural and urban form (Grondslagen/Foundations I, II, III) and give focused lectures on specialised topics (in English) in the Master and PhD programmes according to his/her individual research interests. He/she will also supervise Master and PhD students. Rank and salary are commensurate with qualifications and professional experience. A Tenure Track, a process leading up to a permanent appointment with the prospect of becoming an Associate or Full Professor, offers young, talented academics a clear and attractive career path. During the Tenure Track, you will have the opportunity to develop into an internationally acknowledged and recognised academic. We offer a structured career and personal development programme designed to offer individual academics as much support as possible. For more information about the Tenure Track and the personal development programme, please visit www.tudelft.nl/tenuretrack Applicants must have a proven background in architectural and/or urban history and a PhD degree in an appropriate discipline. The candidate is expected to have some teaching experience and be committed to research excellence, as demonstrated by academic publications. He/she has a demonstrated ability to initiate and direct research projects and to obtain external funding. The candidate possesses good communication and people skills and is capable of teaching at the university level. In addition, the candidate is expected to have an international profile with an active international network of scientific contacts. Demonstrated ability in written and spoken English is required. Knowledge of Dutch is welcome but not required at the start of the position. A tenure-track position is offered for six years. Based on performance indicators agreed upon at the start of the appointment, a decision will be made by the fifth year whether to offer you a permanent faculty position. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, a discount for health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged. An International Childres’s Centre offers childcare and an international primary school. Dual Career Services offers support to accompanying partners. Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. The TU Delft sets specific standards for the English competency of the teaching staff. The TU Delft offers training to improve English competency. Inspiring, excellent education is our central aim. If you have less than five years of experience and do not yet have your teaching certificate, we allow you up to three years to obtain this. For more information about this position, please contact Prof. Carola Hein, atc.m.hein@tudelft.nl . To apply, please send a detailed CV, three references, a publication list and publication samples along with a letter of application by 1 December 2016 to Caro Coemans, HR-BK@tudelft.nl . We will begin reviewing applications on 1 December 2016 and will continue until the position is filled. We are planning faculty visits in December 2016 and/or January 2017. We expect the new colleague to start between 1 February and 1 September 2017. When applying for this position, please refer to vacancy number BK2016-30.

Position Summary Minimum qualifications

  • Ph.D. in Applied Linguistics, Second Language Acquisition, Foreign Language Education, Bilingual Education, Curriculum and Instruction, or related field (the Ph.D. degree should be in hand by the application deadline);.
  • Native or near-native spoken and written proficiency in English;.
  • Two years of teaching experience at the college or university level;.
  • Strong record of effective teaching;.
  • Record of on-going research engagement or strong publication potential;.
  • Demonstrated interest and experience in curricular innovation and pedagogical methods (e.g., online, hybrid, or distance learning);.
  • Administrative and grant-writing experience is not required but desirable.
Preferred Qualifications The Language Center KIMEP University Almaty, Kazakhstan

st Compensation Application Process

HR portal:
  • Filled and submitted application form.
  • Cover letter that indicates the position applied, how you meet the minimum and preferred qualifications, course(s) you can teach, and salary expectations.
  • Short-listed candidates are required to submit 2 recommendation letters.
Closing date for submission of applications: December 1, 2016

KIMEP University Language Center POSITION DESCRIPTION Assistant Professor of Applied Linguistics (Effective 16 August 2017) KIMEP University Language Center invites applicants for position of Assistant Professor of Applied Linguistics. Area of specialization within the field of Applied Linguistics is open, though applicants should be able to teach a variety of courses. This is a full-time appointment, renewable subject to strong performance evaluations. Duties include (but are not limited to) teaching 12 hours per week (one-two graduate courses per semester and two-three undergraduate courses), advising graduate students, developing curricular materials for English language instruction and TEFL courses, conducting research in your specialized area, and university service. Preference will be given to candidates who are familiar with testing and assessment, child language acquisition and early bilingual education. The Language Center has a faculty of 26 full-time faculty and 6 administrative staff. The Master of Arts degree in Teaching English as a Foreign Language at KIMEP University (Almaty, Kazakhstan) was esta­blish­ed in 2006 to enhance the quality of English language instruction in Kazakhstan. It is now established as one of the leading Teaching English as a Foreign Language programs (MA FL) in Kazakhstan and Central Asia with an emphasis on research and on promoting the professional development of practicing teachers and received international accreditation from the Agency of Quality Assurance and Accreditation Austria in Fall 2013. KIMEP University is the leading American-style, internationally-accredited, English-speaking academic institution in the Commonwealth of Independent States. It provides a world-class academic experience and a unique inter­national environment to all its students and faculty. KIMEP was established in 1992 and has built a very strong regional reputation as a leading provider of higher education. All graduate and undergraduate programs are accre­dited by at least one recognized international accreditation agency. Academic programs are regularly rated in the top rank of provision by national bodies. The city of Almaty is situated at the base of majestic Tien Shan Mountains in Southeast Kazakhstan. About 2 million people live in or near Almaty because it is the financial, cultural, summer and winter sports and cosmopolitan capital of Kazakhstan. Kazakhstan is located in the heart of Eurasia with important commercial inroads bridging Asia and Europe. Boasting the Silk Road of the 21 century, Kazakhstan offers unique positions in oil and gas, economic development, and trade. With a transitioning economy that has witnessed four-fold growth over the past decade, Kazakhstan's dynamically changing economic, social, educational and cultural environment provides incredible opportunities for significant and original research. Rank and salary are competitive and commensurate with experience and qualifications. Compensation after-tax compares favorably with net salaries in western countries. Limited on-campus housing is available to rent. In addition to salary, a benefits package includes basic healthcare, reduced tuition rates for KIMEP courses, subsidy for children's school tuition and relocation allowance. New faculty members are provided with a reduced teaching schedule during the first semester. Summer paid teaching is typically available. Please submit the following documents to KIMEP University Address any questions to: recruitment@kimep.kz Personal data provided by applicants will be kept confidential and used for recruitment purpose only. Only short-listed candidates will be informed and invited for interviews. The position remains open until filled.

新加坡科技设计大学

新加坡科技大学设计 (SUTD) 邀请联接的任期轨道或终身约会在所有领域中的计算机科学和计算机工程。优先将给质量课堂教学使用主动学习的证明的研究记录的算法、 网络安全和分布式计算，和一个潜在的候选人。职责包括教学的研究生和本科生课程、 研究、 监督和服务。内标是教师的致力于所有领域，包括性别和种族创建不同组。新加坡提供各种机会具有很强的金融支持的研究。可用的网络安全研究人员是在发电、 分发及管理; 提供世界级的互联试验床的往来中心隶属关系水处理;水分布;和互联网的东西。当前焦点在往来安全网络物理系统、 物联网和大型规模通信网络的设计中包括了研究。SUTD 是在麻省理工学院 (MIT) 和浙江大学在中国合作建立的。SUTD 与麻省理工学院的合作包括发展的课程和课程，协助教师和学生招生、 辅导、 职业发展和合作的联合研究项目通过国际设计中心。成功的候选人可以期待国际上具有竞争力的薪酬，迁往新加坡，援助和获得有吸引力的筹资机会。请提交您的应用程序包在 http://www.sutd.edu.sg/academic/。应用程序将被接受，直到填补职位。

The University of Göttingen has position openings for

15 November 2016

to join the Research Training Group (RTG) 1666 "Transformation of Global Agri-Food Systems" (GlobalFood) funded by the German Research Foundation (DFG). The positions should be filled by 1 April 2017 with a contract duration of three years. The salary is in accordance with the German public service salary scale E13 TVL (65 %). These are qualification positions for junior re­searchers pursuing a PhD degree. The positions' duties include research on questions related to the restructuring of agricultural markets, including the growing role of international food standards and the rapid expansion of supermarkets. Projects analyze the implications for supply chain governance, trade flows, market efficiency, ethical consumption, and impacts on poverty, food security, and nutrition in developing countries. In terms of methodologies, econometric and ex­peri­men­tal economics approaches are used. The research and training activities are carried out in cooperation with the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI). The positions are based in Göttingen, but will require international travel for data collection and exchange with collaborators. Successful candidates will have an outstanding Master degree (or equivalent) in agricultural economics, agri­bu­siness, marketing, development economics, general economics, or a related discipline, strong analytical skills, experience with quantitative research methods, proven interest in topics related to GlobalFood, strong computer skills, and excellent command of the English language. Experience with data collection in an international context will be a plus. The University of Göttingen is an equal opportunities employer and places particular emphasis on fostering career opportunities for women. Qualified women are therefore strongly encouraged to apply in fields in which they are underrepresented. The University has committed itself to being a family-friendly institution and supports their em­ployees in balancing work and family life. Please submit your application electronically until via the Online Application Portal. Your elec­tro­nic documents will be deleted three months after the selection process is finished. Further details about the GlobalFood RTG and the link to the application portal can be found on our website www.uni-goettingen.de/globalfood ).

2 PhD Scholarships, Silicon Quantum Computation and Atomic Electronics

(Salary Level: AUD $26,000 per annum with a supplement of up to $6,000 per annum for first class degrees or equivalent)

PhD student: Silicon Quantum Computation

Applications close:



Contact:

The Australian Centre of Excellence for Quantum Computation & Communication Technology is the world’s largest team working to develop a scalable spin based quantum computing architecture in silicon. Headquartered in Sydney, the Centre is renowned internationally for its pioneering research in atomic manipulation, atomic electronics and high frequency cryogenic control of qubits in silicon. The Centre is expanding and offering unique research associate positions and PhD scholarships. We seek outstanding and enthusiastic PhD candidates to work in multi-qubit silicon-based quantum computation with ESR control and to develop and electrically characterize a novel quantum integrated circuit chip based on atomically precise three dimensional architectures. Candidates will learn the latest techniques in our internationally unique atomic manipulation program in how to make and measure devices with atomic-scale precision using low noise, high frequency electrical measurements at cryogenic temperatures. 31 October 2016 or until position filled Professor Michelle Simmons, Email: michelle.simmons@unsw.edu.au

短的描述︰ 我们的团队研究了氢的流动性和其他基于可再生能源。这种开创性技术面临的主要挑战是所谓的"问题鸡蛋"。缺乏基础设施抑制同时缺少需求基础设施的发展不是经济上可行的同时，氢动力汽车收购。你的任务是评价与低功耗低成本电解系统模块化使用。要做到这一点，将模拟系统，以满足上升时间氢气需要在 MATLAB 和评价结果的框架内的一项可行性研究逐步改造。它应该检查是否比较激励可以创建较低的初始投资成本为氢基础设施的发展。先决条件︰ 您应该自定义经验在科学工作中，已经有至少一个更广泛的工作。理想情况下，学生/机械工程、 能源工程、 车辆技术或其他相关专业的学生，有良好的理解。它给你没有麻烦工作迅速在复杂的问题。经验和知识在 MATLAB，处理，以及知识经济计算是首选。我们假设独立、 系统、 细致的方式工作，以及能力的通信和文件的工作结果。联系方式︰ 请发送您的应用程序通过电子邮件和电话查询的完整简历给指定联系人。

Research Fellow/Senior Research Fellow

(Salary Level: approx. AUD A$98K - A$137K per year (plus 17% employer superannuation and leave loading)

Research Fellow/Senior Research Fellow: Silicon Quantum Computation (Job Opening ID 56892):

Applications close:

The Australian Centre of Excellence for Quantum Computation & Communication Technology is the world’s largest team working to develop a scalable spin based quantum computing architecture in silicon. Headquartered in Sydney, the Centre is renowned internationally for its pioneering research in atomic manipulation, atomic electronics and high frequency cryogenic control of qubits in silicon. The Centre is expanding and offering unique research associate positions and PhD scholarships. This prestigious research position will provide an ambitious experimental scientist with a globally unique opportunity to design, characterize and measure multi-qubit devices relevant to the development of a silicon-based quantum computer. The research will investigate the controlled coupling of multi-qubit devices, and the coherent transport of quantum information. Experiments will involve the configuration and operation of high-frequency electronics compatible with cryogenic measurements. Applications are only received via our website: www.jobs.unsw.edu.au . Search using the Job Opening ID: 56892. In addition to an outstanding academic record, candidates should possess enthusiasm, ambition, and cultural sensibilities to contribute as part of a vibrant team. These are full-time contract positions for two years and extendable to three years by mutual agreement. Applicants should systematically address the selection criteria. 31 October 2016

18 次，德国研究基金会 (DFG) 写道"沟通奖-stifterverband 德国模具德意志提交科学奖"。这个个人奖是赋有 EUR 50 000 到科学家，并授予科学家从所有学科人传达他们的科研工作，结果，以及在媒体和非科学的公共车厢卓著。荣获科学与公众之间的对话应该加强和招募在同一时间，调解接收更高的优先级的科学作为科学家的工作的一部分。奖的最重要标准是宽度和多样性，以及创意和可持续性的调解和对话框性能。在单个项目中的应用是不可能的。申请人必须在德语世界处于活动状态。对个别的科学家以及一组研究人员可以获得奖项。不包括的更大的单位，如部门或整个大学与他们的沟通策略。自己的应用程序，以及获奖者的建议是可能的。应用程序应该包含关于调解性能信息文档 （达 50 页作为代表性的整体工作，视听的贡献只有卡带或 DVD，在线博客和其他社交媒体员额中的链接形式的注释）。第二位科学家或一位科学家的书面的评估清楚脱颖而出通信性能是自动应用程序需要。每个应用程序，一份简历申请另外;具体而言，不应附科学出版物目录。应用程序和建议-最好是以数字形式-现在可以提交最迟将在德国研究社区、 新闻和公共关系，Kennedyallee 40 53175 波恩。陪审团的通信科学家、 记者、 公关专业人士和 DFG 的副主席的主持下所选的科学家决定颁发奖。选择和宣布优胜者是发生的颁奖典礼上星期一 2017 年 7 月 3 日，到 2017 年，春季的哈雷 DFG 年度会议框架内。有关价格和以前奖获奖者和获奖者下︰ DFG 的秘书的办公室里联系人︰ 博士 Jutta Rateike，新闻和公共关系，管理公共关系，电话: + 49 228 885-2665

January 2017

November 4, 2016

The Max Planck Institute aims to increase the number of women in scientific positions. Female candidates are therefore particularly encouraged to apply. In case of equal qualifications, candidates with disabilities will take precedence.

The Max Planck Institute for the Physics of Complex Systems (MPIPKS) seeks one The successful candidate will complement research areas pursued at the institute and conduct independent studies e.g. in the following theoretical research fields: Ultracold gases, attosecond and ultrafast X-ray physics, molecular electronics, correlated electrons and magnetism, quantum information theory, statistical physics far from equilibrium, nonlinear dynamics, biological physics of cells and tissues , and quantitative biology. Novel directions with promising perspectives are also welcome. The position can start by , or any later date that year. Distinguished PKS postdoctoral fellows appear personally along with the departments and groups on the main research page of the institute. Further details of research oppor­tunities can be found on our web-site: http://www.pks.mpg.de The appointment is for two years, renewable for one more year. To apply for the position, please fill the online application form and upload your application package (cover letter, curriculum vitae, list of publications, statement of research interests and research proposal as well as the three most relevant publications) in one pdf file. Please also arrange for three letters of reference to be submitted via http://www.pks.mpg.de/~visitors/reference Application deadline is

Central Institute for mental health

the Central Institute of mental health (National Foundation of under public law) is an internationally recognized psychiatric/Neuroscience Research Institute, psychiatric, psychotherapeutic and psychosomatic Department of the medical faculty of Mannheim, the University of Heidelberg, as well as a psychiatric, psychotherapeutic and psychosomatic clinic with University orientation. Currently at the ZI 326 full - and part-stationary beds and treatment sites are operated, distributed on four clinics: psychiatry and psychotherapy including psychotherapeutic, psychosomatic and psychotherapeutic medicine, psychiatry and psychotherapy of the childhood and adolescence, dependent behavior and addiction Medicine In the context of a multi-year construction project held a gradual increase to a total of about 390 beds and treatment sites. This generation allows the establishment of new therapies and outpatient inpatient care concepts. In parallel, we will attain a marked increase in our therapy relevant research structures with newly commissioned the Centre for innovative Psychiatry and psychotherapy research. Our working group examined neurobiological and psychological basics of borderline personality disorder and post-traumatic stress disorder with emphasis on affect regulation, self-representation and interaction of psychotherapy with neurobiological processes. Currently completing work on the subject of self assessment, in particular with regard to the Boderline personality disorder, be awarded.

within the framework of your master's thesis, you are introduced on the following topics: - literature preparation - data collection and analysis - create a thesis our expectations of you: - psychology, medicine, neuroscience, or a related study of the fields of study trade - matriculation at a German University - reliable, independent, as well as knowledge of Microsoft Office and SPSS are independent working - time flexibility - advantage we offer: - an interesting research activity in a leading international research institute - the opportunity , on writing work to get additional insight in the Working Group have further questions you can one woman Dipl.-Psych. Dorina winter, E-Mail: Dorina.Winter@zi-mannheim.de, contact. We look forward to receiving your application through our online career portal. KIMEP 大学语言中心职位描述助理教授应用语言学 （有效 2017 年 8 月 16 日） KIMEP 大学语言中心邀请申请人应用语言学助理教授的职位。领域内的应用语言学领域是专业的开放，尽管申请人应该能够教的各种课程。这是一个全职的约会，可再生进行强性能评价。职责包括 （但不是限于） 教学 12 小时每周 （包揽前二，每学期的研究生课程） 和两个三大学本科课程，指导研究生的学生，发展英语语言教学和英语教学课程的课程材料，在你的专业的领域和大学服务进行研究。熟悉测试和评估、 儿童语言习得和早期的双语教育的考生，可获优先考虑。语言中心设有系的 26 全职教师和 6 名行政人员。硕士学位教学英语作为外语在 KIMEP 大学 （哈萨克斯坦阿拉木图） 成立于 2006 年在哈萨克斯坦的英语语言教学的素质。它现在建立作为一个领先的英语教学作为一门外语节目 （佛罗里达州） 的马在哈萨克斯坦和中亚地区重点放在研究和促进实习教师的专业发展和从机构的质量保证和认证奥地利秋天 2013 年获得国际认可。KIMEP 大学是领先美式风格，国际上认可的讲英语的学术机构在独立国家联合体。它向所有学生和教师提供世界一流的学术经验和独特的国际环境。KIMEP 成立于 1992 年，建立了很强的区域声誉作为一家领先的高等教育。研究生和本科生的所有程序都是由至少一个被认可的国际认证机构都认可的。学术课程由国家机构在第一流的规定定期对估计。阿拉木图市位于雄伟的天山山脉在哈萨克斯坦东南部的基础。约 200 万人居住在或附近阿拉木图，因为它是金融、 文化、 夏季和冬季体育和国际资本的哈萨克斯坦。哈萨克斯坦位于欧亚大陆中心与弥合亚洲和欧洲的重要商业进军。拥有 21 世纪的丝绸之路，哈萨克斯坦提供石油和天然气、 经济发展和贸易中的独特地位。与过去十年增长四倍的过渡经济，哈萨克斯坦的动态变化的经济、 社会、 教育和文化环境提供重大和原始的研究令人难以置信的机会。等级和工资是竞争和经验和资历相称。补偿税后媲美西方国家薪金净额。有限的住校是可以租的。除了工资，福利包括基本医疗保障，KIMEP 课程，申请减免的学费率子女学校学费和搬迁津贴补贴。新教员提供第一学期期间减少的教学日程安排。夏季受薪的教学是通常可用的。将以下文件到 KIMEP 大学地址到任何问题，请提交︰ recruitment@kimep.kz 由申请人提供的个人资料将被保密，并只作招聘用途使用。只有合格的候选人将通知和邀请，并安排面试。位置保持打开状态，直到填充。

 V-448/16 (starting at 01/04/17 / for a period of 3 years; an extension of 3 more years is possible after successful evaluation / closing date for applications 13/10/16)

Working field:

Teaching within Bachelor and Master programs in the area of Smart Water Networks, e.g. Smart Metering/ Smart City/ Smart Grid, designing smart water networks and digitalization of fluid systems.

Research in smart water and wastewater infrastructures , which should encompass the following areas:
  • Digital strategies and solutions to optimize the complex water and wastewater infrastructures, focusing on quality, environmental protection and resource efficiency.
  • Linking of different, data-based systems (control systems of infrastructures, simulation of supply networks, meteorological predictions, etc.).
  • Ecologically, economically and socially acceptable use of Smart Metering/ Smart City Solutions/ Smart Grid Solutions
  • Consequences, limits and risks linked with the digitalization of water and wastewater infrastructures.

Requirements:



13/10/2016 reference number Dekan der Fakultät V, Sekr. H 11, Straße des 17. Juni 135, 10623 Berlin or by email to personal@vm.tu-berlin.de

Successful applicants must fulfill the requirements for appointment at the professor level in compliance with § 102a BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act), including a completed academic education, qualified achievements in research and a particular qualification for academic work normally attested by the excellent quality of a PhD, and pedagogical didactic qualifications, to be proven by teaching experience and visualized in a teaching portfolio (for further information see TUB Website , quick as no. 144242). Qualified research achievements and expertise in at least one of the areas described above, as well as extensive knowledge in the area of informatics and computer sciences, in particular in complex networks and Big Data. The scholarships are available from April 1st, 2017, for one year.

We welcome applications from graduates aiming to write their doctoral thesis at the Bamberg Graduate School of Social Sciences. A scholarship will enable you to develop an excellent research proposal and submit it to appropriate funding bodies. BAGSS supports scholarship holders through personal mentoring, workshops and support services. BAGSS is a multidisciplinary Graduate School funded by the German Science Foundation (DFG) as part of the German Excellence Initiative. We are seeking to stimulate and guide cutting-edge doctoral research on some of the most crucial challenges modern knowledge­based societies are facing.

Qualification & Requirements

We are inviting applications by highly qualified graduates from the fields of Sociology, Psychology, Educational Science, Political Science, Labour and Educational Economics, Demography and Statistics. Candidates must hold a Master’s degree (or equivalent) in one of the aforementioned subjects or be very close to completion. International applications are encouraged but successful applicants will be required to take up their residence in Bamberg, a city noted for its high quality of life and great conditions for research and study. Scholarships amount to a monthly stipend of 1.468 Euro, plus family allowances and child-care expenses in accordance with the DFG guidelines where applicable. The Graduate School is committed to diversity, equal opportunities and the compatibility of family and career within its statutory obligations.

tasks setting requirements 04.11.2016 Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz Universität Hannover

at the Institute of wind energy systems is to occupy a position as the 01.01.2017. The place is run initially for three years. A promotion in the context of the vacancy is strongly encouraged. The task pane includes the participation in research and teaching. This includes also the processing and acquisition of research projects, organisation of training events and taking care of student work. The research topic is located in the area of Aero-elastic stability of rotor blades and wind turbines. Specifically, an existing methodology for the calculation of critical flow velocities should be automated and extended. The position is embedded in a joint research project, which deals with intelligent blade technologies. In close cooperation with federated partners should be carried out Aero-elastic stability analysis of rotor blade concepts and evaluated the results in the context of the overall system. The setting requires a scientific engineer degree (Diplom or master) with a focus in the aeroelasticity. In-depth knowledge of Aero-elastic stability and wind energy technology are desirable. We require very good knowledge of English. We expect a high degree of self-motivation, independence, communication skills, organizational assets, and teamwork. The workplace is suitable for staffing with part-time employees, provided that this can be covered fully by a total. The Leibniz University Hanover wants especially to promote professional equality between women and men and urges therefore qualified women to apply. Disabled applicants are preferred with the same qualifications. For information is Mr. Dr.-ing. Claudio Balzani, Tel. 0511/762-5612, E-Mail: claudio.balzani@iwes.uni-hannover.de, do not hesitate to. Reference number:

 II-440/16 (starting at the earliest possible / for a period of 3 years; an extension of 3 more years is possible after successful evaluation / closing date for applications 13/10/16)

Working field:

The successful candidate will be a professor at the Institute for Solid State Physics, Faculty II – Mathematics and Natural Science, Technische Universität Berlin and at the same time be the leader of an independent research group at Fraunhofer Heinrich-Hertz-Institut (HHI).

Technische Universität Berlin and the Fraunhofer Institute for Telecommunication, Heinrich-Hertz-Institute co-operate in research and development in the field of ultra-fast opto-electronic semi-conductor devices and their applications. Within the framework of this co-operation both partners want to strengthen the teaching and research in the field of Terahertz sensors. The focus will be on the research and development of new devices and sensors in InGaAs/InP-materials for the efficient generation and detection of Terahertz-radiation.

Candidates for the position are expected to participate adequately in the teaching for the degree courses of the Faculty II – Mathematics and Natural Science. At the same time candidates will conduct be the leader of an independent research group at Fraunhofer Heinrich-Hertz-Institute (HHI).

Requirements:

  • Opto-electronic generation und detection of THz-radiation.
  • Micro-structuring in InP-materials.
  • Conception of integrated optical devices (laser, waveguides, modulators) for the use in THz-systems.
  • Radio-frequency engineering, design of antennae and waveguides.
  • Pulsed and cw-THz-metrology and their industrial application areas.
written 13/10/2016 reference number Fakultät II, Institut für Optik und Atomare Physik, Sekr. ER 1-1, Hardenbergstr. 36A, 10623 Berlin

The appointment for the professorship is part of the cooperation of the Einstein Center Digital Future partners. Successful applicants must fulfill the requirements for appointment at the professor level in compliance with § 102a BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act), including a completed academic education, qualified achievements in research and a particular qualification for academic work normally attested by the excellent quality of a PhD, and pedagogical didactic qualifications, to be proven by teaching experience and visualized in a teaching portfolio (for further information see TUB Website , quick as no. 144242). Applicants should have adequate expertise and experience in at least one of the following research areas: Applicants should have shown academic expertise in the field of opto-electronic generation and detection of Terahertzwaves and should be able to manage their own research group and organize scientific projects. The area of research expertise should allow co-operations with adjoining research groups as well as participation in current and future collaborative research activities. Experience in the acquisition of third-party funding from industry and public funding organizations is advantageous. Technische Universität Berlin strives to increase the proportion of women in research and teaching and therefore strongly encourages qualified female researchers to apply. Qualified individuals with disabilities will be favored. Technische Universität Berlin is a certified family-friendly higher education institution, and our Dual Career Service offers assistance to you and your family when relocating to Berlin. Please send your application until with the and the usual documents to Technische Universität Berlin - Der Präsident -, . Please note that applications via email cannot be considered. Please send copies only. Original documents will not be returned. The vacancy is also available on the internet at

W1 junior professorship translational multimodal imaging in neurology

medical school/University Clinic of RWTH Aachen University

is sought at the earliest possible date a personality representing this subject in research and teaching. The professorship is limited initially to three years; positive interim evaluation is given an extension for a further three years. The professorship is located in the Department of Neurology of the University Clinic of RWTH Aachen. Applications from the disciplines of the natural sciences, medicine or psychology are expected. The professorship is the translational research and application of new methods in the field of multimodality Imaging in the clinical neurosciences. These include methods in the field of MRI, PET and the EEG. Specifically the Chair with the quantification of MR-PET should be data, the structural and functional imaging, the sodium MR imaging and high-field MRI PET (9,4T MR-PET) deal. The combination opens up unique possibilities for research and application of new methods of basic and translational neuroscience. The professorship is situates in the Jülich Aachen Research Alliance (JARA-BRAIN) and associated with a membership in the institutes INM-4 and JARA-BRAIN II. JARA-BRAIN represents the established intensive cooperation of the Institute of Neurosciences and medicine of Jülich Research Centre with the medical faculty of RWTH Aachen University in the field of Translational brain research in Psychiatry and Neurology. Readiness for interdisciplinary and scientific cooperation with the institutes of the Faculty of medicine and the clinics of the University Clinic of RWTH Aachen is also provided as the cooperation with the Helmholtz-Institute for biomedical engineering and the engineering and scientific disciplines of the RWTH Aachen. Requirements also include the participation in the research priorities of the departments and associated research networks (such as CRC TRR 57, JARA, IZKF AACHEN). A dedicated collaboration model studying medicine and biomedical engineering master course is also expected. Requirements are a completed university degree and a special qualification to the scientific work, which is proven by an outstanding promotion. In addition, teaching skills are expected. Receipts for minimalistic as well as a teaching portfolio should be attached to the application.

St.Gallen 大学物流管理的椅子现在或搜索协议与营运资本管理有关的 mmid / 供应链融资多样和苛刻活动兴趣在框架内实际的研究。"物流与供应链管理"（在一般），以及"供应链融资"和"营运资本管理"的主题 （特别是）.具有挑战性和不同任务领域的供应链管理有密切接触的工业贸易和服务的公司。区域之间的阿尔卑斯山和康斯坦茨湖与高生活质量和有吸引力的休闲机会。什么指望三至六个月的实习中充分的时间。战略发展该地区的营运资本管理 / 供应链融资。 独立分析和制备的研究结果。援助组织的事件 （例如颁奖典礼）。在事件与我们实践伙伴的积极参与。每月津贴 CHF 1,600。实习的灵活的开学日期。以 Web 与高动机、 沟通技巧和团队合作精神。独立和结构化的方式工作。高的分析技能。对科学写作时，良好的书面的表达 （德国） 的乐趣。非常好的办公软件产品 （特别是 MS Excel 和 MS PowerPoint） 的知识。供应链管理和/或财务方面的知识是有益的。在一个经济、 通信或社会科学课程的先进或已完成研究。为实质性和正式问题联系人︰ 朱迪思 · 马丁，judith.martin@unisg.ch，电话︰ 0041 (0) 71 224 7290。请向您的应用程序在关键字"SCF 实验室"之下︰ 博士教授沃尔夫冈 · Stölzle，wolfgang.stoelzle@unisg.ch.

CALL FOR APPLICATIONS APPLICATION DEADLINE

NOVEMBER 14, 2016 FOR APPLICATIONS FROM GERMANY

The Commonwealth Fund invites promising mid-career professionals – government policymakers, academic researchers, clinical leaders, senior hospital and insurance managers, and journalists – from Germany to apply for a unique opportunity to spend up to 12 months in the U.S. working with leading experts to study health care delivery system reforms and critical issues on the health policy agenda in both the U.S. and Germany. Further enriching the program, The Commonwealth Fund brings together the full class of fellows – from Australia, Canada, France, Germany, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, and the U.K. – throughout the year to participate in a series of high level policy briefings and leadership seminars with health care leaders. Each fellowship provides up to U.S. $130,000 in support, which covers roundtrip airfare to the U.S., living allowance, project-related travel, travel to fellowship seminars, health insurance, and U.S. federal and state taxes. A family supplement (i.e., approximately $60,000 for a partner and two children up to age 18) is also provided to cover airfare, living allowance, and health insurance. For more details about eligibility, the project, or the application process, please visit www.commonwealthfund.org/fellowships The Commonwealth Fund is a private foundation, established in 1918 and based in New York, which aims to promote a high performing health care system that achieves better access, improved quality, and greater efficiency, particularly for society’s most vulnerable.

LMU MUNICH is one of the strongest research universities in Europe. The diversity of disciplines at the University provides innovative research in all academic areas. As an integral part of the knowledge, culture and economic metropolis of Munich LMU MUNICH offers an optimal infrastructure its scholars and scientists for basic research to the transfer application-oriented research in technologies. As one of the leading research universities in Germany and Europe, we want to attract outstanding scientists and scientists at all career stages, and promote new research ideas. The creative intelligence of young scientists and scholars is indispensable for a future-oriented University. Therefore, we create favorable research and qualification conditions for doctoral students. We offer reliable career opportunities for young scientists and scientists - such as offers for the targeted promotion in the postdoctoral phase or through our tenure-track model, which we successfully implement long.

LMU MUNICH was the most successful University in the German competition for excellence: in the second phase of the excellence initiative, the results of which were announced in June 2012, were all applications of LMU -four graduate schools four cluster of excellence and institutional strategy LMUexcellent - approved. Already in the first round of the Germany-wide competition to strengthen the University research LMU MUNICH in all three lines of funding was successful.

"政治 Futurisation" 责任︰
  • 到未来的设想和面向未来的行为的社会心理研究︰
    • 分析对看法，个人经验，设置、 社会规范、 公开、 可逆性和 Unprogrammable 的上下文中的位置
    • 变化的社会实践和集体知识关于可持续发展的社会因素，调查
    • 在这方面的个人和社会环境之间的相互作用
    。
  • 摘要的心理学理论和构造的帮助解释面向未来和可持续思维和行动。
  • 的设计与实现协作实证研究项目与项目 ' 政治学 Futurisation' 跨学科团队。
  • 出版的同行评审和适当格式结果。

Reference number:

 IV-444/16 (starting at 01/04/17 / for a period of 3 years; an extension of 3 more years is possible after successful evaluation / closing date for applications 13/10/16)

Working field:

TU Berlin aims to strengthen the research and teaching in the area of "Mobile Cloud Computing". The focus of research is set on the development of methods and technologies for seamless integration of cloud-based and network-based infrastructures. The main goal is to replace the existing, centralized, tenant-based cloud systems through decentralized, tightly integrated network-cloud systems, which can fulfill complex real-time application requirements. Moreover, an integrated solution should guarantee the preservation of privacy requirements and allow the creation of novel business models. Finally, innovative research directions such as computational offloading and crowd sourcing need to be considered and deployed in context of new application areas such as virtual and augmented reality. The successful candidate is expected to contribute to the curriculum in the study programs provided by the faculty on computer science and electrical engineering.

Requirements:

  • Cloud und Mobile Computing.
  • Mobile Edge.
  • Peer-to-Peer-Systems.
  • Integration of privacy preserving solutions.
  • Teaching experience.
13/10/2016 reference number Dekan der Fakultät IV, Sekr. MAR 6-1, Marchstraße 23, 10587 Berlin or by email to dekanat@eecs.tu-berlin.de

TU Berlin aims to strengthen the research and teaching in the area of "Distributed security infrastructures". The focus of research is set on the development of methods and technologies for ensuring data security and data integrity in potentially vulnerable distributed environments. The main goal is to revise the current concept of server-based security by developing methods for security through distribution of data among many locations.

  • Distributed data storage

  • Security in distributed systems
  • Security concepts for industrial IT systems.
  • Security technologies in light of human usage and perception

我们寻求一个有才华的、 动态的、 很高的积极性的年轻科学家，来加入我们部生物机制的老龄问题，( http://www.age.mpg.de/science/research-labs/partridge) 为首主任教授琳达鹧鸪。我们感兴趣的申请人有背景的鼠标生物学和/或高吞吐量的数据分析。成功的候选人将参加优秀的科学环境的热情和协作的团队。新闻部考察了老化机制并与衰老相关的疾病，用水果飞果蝇和小鼠作为实验模式生物。我们的工作与高通量技术相结合在体内分型 (蛋白质组学、 代谢组学、 RNA 序列、 亚硫酸 Seq)，分子生物学、 生物化学和高分辨率的成像，研究如何药理、 膳食和遗传干预措施延长健康和小鼠的寿命。该职位是从最早的时间点可用。马克斯 · 普朗克研究所生物学的老化被成立于 2008 年为了解健康老龄化的基本机制。它是在科隆-波恩地区致力于研究老龄问题的研究机构广泛网络的一部分和年龄有关的疾病，包括 CECAD 优秀群集在科隆大学构成研究一个充满活力和协作环境。配有先进的技术和卓越的核心设施，成功的候选人将有权访问的研究所提供其科学家杰出的研究机会。目前，我们举办了来自 34 个不同国家的员工。成功的候选人将举行在生物学、 分子生物学、 生物化学或相关的专业的硕士学位文凭。申请人应具备较强的书面和口头沟通技能。工作语言是英语;德国语言的知识不是必需的。经验中的以下方法之一︰ 体内小鼠表型、 遗传学、 表观遗传学、 药理学、 高吞吐量的数据分析是一种优势。应该用我们应用程序的网站 http://www.age.mpg.de/career/open-positions/，直到 2016 年 11 月 6 日上传。就业合同基于合同为公务员 （TVöD-外滩，Tarifvertrag 德国 den öffentlichen 扩大） 和将时间有限。成功的候选人将举行在生物学、 分子生物学、 生物化学或相关的专业的硕士学位文凭。申请人应具备较强的书面和口头沟通技能。工作语言是英语;德国语言的知识不是必需的。经验中的以下方法之一︰ vivomouse 分型，遗传学，表观遗传学、 药理学、 高吞吐量的数据分析是一种优势。应该用我们应用程序的网站 http://www.age.mpg.de/career/open-positions/，直到 2016 年 11 月 6 日上传。我们提供的马克斯 · 普朗克学会青年研究人员根据供资指导方针的三年合同。非正式询问欢迎，应该发送到 lpartridge@age.mpg.de。为进一步了解研究所见 www.age.mpg.de 马克斯 · 普朗克学会致力于雇用更多残疾的个人和尤其是鼓励他们申请。马克斯 · 普朗克学会旨在增加妇女在这些领域他们任职人数不足，特别是鼓励他们申请。

Reference number:

 2/1522/16

Working field:

In collaboration with other Berlin universities and research institutions, various aspects of the digital transformation will be explored. Within the Einstein Center Digital Future, new professors will strengthen the academic community of Berlin in the field of digitalization. In this context the Berlin University of the Arts has developed the Berlin Open Lab, a space for reflection and research, and a place of experimental digital fabrication in the design disciplines. New forms of interaction with technologies will be created and explored holistically as technological-economical-sociological artefacts.

Subject area:

Wearable Computing

Teaching responsibilities:

4 course hours (for the first 3 years, 6 course hours from the 4th year)

Job description:

Berlin Open Lab

Requirements:

written designation of the reference number October 13, 2016 by mail

The junior professorship is to be funded in the context of the Einstein Center Digital Future. The professorship is offered under the reserve that funds are granted. Instruction and research on new forms of interactive clothing and embedded systems related to wearable computing, interactive textiles and clothing concepts as new forms of human-technology interaction; development of new types of interaction principles and testing with prototypes; artistic and academic reflection on new technologies in the field of Wearable Computing, the Internet of things and Interaction Design considering current positions in fashion design; establishment of the at UdK cooperating with partners from the Einstein Center Digital Future through new formats of teaching and research; participation in academic self administration. Academic degree in design or a related discipline, completed doctorate or years of artistic-academic research experience in the field of design or a related discipline with very good proficiency in the field of fashion technologies and/or interactive textiles (practical design, technological, methodical); comprehensive list of publications; paedagogical and didactical skills and experience; experience in interdisciplinary and experimental design working methods; very good English language skills. Qualifications for employment in accordance with § 102a BerlHG. The Berlin University of the Arts is particularly committed to the employment and promotion of women; it follows the strategy of gender mainstreaming. Physically challenged persons with the appropriate qualifications will be given preferential consideration. Please indicate this circumstance in the application. Applications from persons with a migrant background who fulfil the qualifications for employment are encouraged. Please submit your application with informative application documents, under no later than to the Berlin University of Art - ZSD 1 -, Postbox 12 05 44, 10595 Berlin. For reasons of cost, the application documents can only be returned if a sufficient prepaid envelope is provided. Additional information is available under www.udk-berlin.de/universitaet/stellenausschreibungen/

Research Assistant (post doc, 100%) Economy & sustainability code FP-2016-02

"Futurisation of politics" responsibilities:
  • research activities with a focus on the Futurisation of the economy:

We offer you application up to the 31.10.2016 a MS Dr. Henrike Squire

the Institute for advanced sustainability studies e.V. (IASS) in Potsdam is an institution sponsored by the Federal Ministry for education and research and by the land of Brandenburg and is dedicated to research on climate change, the components of the Earth system and sustainability in a form of holistic transdisciplinary and international. The successful applicant further information under www.iass-potsdam.de works in the project under the direction of the scientific director Prof. Dr. Patrizia Nanz. In the interdisciplinary project "Futurisation of Politics" vision and future-oriented practice in contemporary politics and society is investigating. While future in the form of images, sustainability standards and forecasting procedures is ubiquitous, the concrete political and social practice remains more diffuse compared with future expectations in the various local global arenas of cooperation. In this context, the project investigates more fundamental conceptual issues for sustainable forms of political representation, the influence of time and change, as well as the concrete future orientation of individuals in different contexts of social and economic processes. an interesting and varied task area in an interdisciplinary team, the opportunity to work on current social issues, good contacts with national and international research institutions and organizations, as well as an attractive, international working environment with good working climate. It's a full-time job. The remuneration according to TVöD (Federal). The position has to be assigned to the 01.01.2017 and to the 31.12.2020 temporary. The service is Potsdam. Applications from women, as well as by applicants and applicants with an immigrant background are strongly encouraged. Applications from severely disabled are considered primarily at equal fitness. Please apply with a one-sided letter of motivation, an appendix with the usual documents, as well as two samples of your work. Please send your complete g. reference number by E-Mail only, stating the above Ms Dr. Henrike Squire ( jobs@iass-potsdam.de, summarized in maximum 5 MB PDF file). Please indicate in your application how you have become attentive to our advertisement. For content questions is available (Tel: +49 331 28822-462).
