the Karlsruhe school of optics & Photonics offered an English master and PhD program in the interdisciplinary field "Optics & Photonics". We are looking for a motivated student assistant for the following tasks: • support in programme management and in the selection process for international students • support international students from the initial information up to the course of the study • organize lectures, seminars, symposia and fairs • online marketing (maintenance and development of the Web site, social media) • statistical analysis using Excel and PowerPoint your profile: we expect in-depth knowledge of all MS Office products, especially Excel , as well as very good knowledge of English and German. Should you desire to work in a team and independently. In addition there should be a high degree of commitment and organizational talent. Our offer: After a training, you are part of a team that works with a passion for the KSOP. An appropriate profile you will receive your own projects, you can serve with high responsibility. We offer a friendly, team-oriented environment with beverage supply. Participation as a student Assistant is usually a month, 80 hours to at least three solid days a week that we set together. We would like to point out that we seek co-operation of at least one year. You set your application with curriculum vitae and transcript please as soon as possible via email to jorinne.sturm@kit.edu. For further information you can reach me also under + 49 721 608-47864.

Singapore University of Technology and Design

The Singapore University of Technology and Design (SUTD) invites applicantions for tenure-track or tenured appointments in all areas of computer science and computer engineering. Priority will be given to candidates with demonstrated research record in algorithms, cyber security, and distributed computing, and a potential for quality classroom teaching using active learning. Duties include teaching of graduate and undergraduate classes, research, supervision, and service. ISTD is committed to creating a diverse group of faculty across all areas including gender and ethnicity. Singapore offers a variety of research opportunities with strong financial support. Available to researchers in cyber security is affiliation with the iTrust center that offers world-class interconnected testbeds in power generation, distribution, and management; water treatment; water distribution; and Internet of Things. Current focus at iTrust includes research in the design of secure Cyber Physical Systems, Internet of Things, and Large Scale Communications Networks. SUTD is established in collaboration with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and Zhejiang University in China. MIT’s collaboration with SUTD includes the development of courses and curricula, assistance with faculty and student recruiting, mentoring, career development, and collaboration on joint research projects through the International Design Centre. Successful candidates can expect internationally competitive remuneration, assistance for relocation to Singapore, and access to attractive funding opportunities. Please submit your application package at http://www.sutd.edu.sg/academic/. Applications will be accepted until positions are filled.

Singapore University of Technology and Design Information Systems Technology and Design 487372 Singapore

Bard College Berlin

Bard College Berlin is seeking to appoint a Professor of Economics (W2/Associate Professorship level) from September 2017. The successful candidate will be an innovative and adaptable teacher within the growing economics component of an interdisciplinary liberal arts BA programme. The purpose of the BA degree is to educate informed citizens capable of engaging critically with disciplinary debates and policy issues, and of becoming leaders in entrepreneurial, community and governmental initiatives. Candidates should be applied microeconomists. A research focus on public choice and/or public economics/public finance or environmental economics will be an advantage, as will the capacity and willingness to teach undergraduate classes in these fields and in microeconomics, game theory or econometrics. The teaching load, consisting of small-group seminar courses, is 10 SWS or a 2/3 courseload. The language of instruction is English. An initial contract will extend for four years (at German W2 salary scale) and the position will be tenured upon successful evaluation. Appointment requirements are governed by §100 of the Berlin University Law (Berliner Hochschulgesetz). Applicants should have a PhD degree, an excellent international track record in teaching and research, an interest in liberal arts education and in interdisciplinary dialogue beyond their fields of specialization. Applications should include a motivation letter, a CV including list of publications, teaching evaluations, a statement on current and future research interests, and 3 publications. Candidates are also asked to provide a brief description of their teaching experience so far (levels of courses and students taught, and approaches taken) and of how they would teach economics in the framework of a liberal arts education. Please send these documents via email to Izabela Westphalen: i.westphalen@berlin.bard.edu Review of applications will begin after November 11, 2016 and continue until the position is filled. Bard College Berlin is an equal opportunity employer. For further informal inquiries about the position please see www.berlin.bard.edu or contact the chair of the search committee, Prof. Dr. Martin Binder (m.binder@berlin.bard.edu).

KIMEP 法学院法律职位描述 KIMEP 大学学院助理教授或副教授 （有效 2017 年 8 月 16 日） 寻求从入门级候选人与优秀的学术记录和潜质优秀的教学和学术成就，为应用程序和应用程序从初级侧候选人拥有出色的学术资历、 教学演示的能力和杰出的奖学金在 2017年-2018 年学年开始。秩为助理或法学院副教授取决于经验，全体教员和大学的批准。我们招聘的需求是灵活的虽然我们有税收，企业银行业务法律/金融领域 （国际）、 知识产权、 国际贸易 （世贸组织），哈萨克斯坦驯养法在海关，特别感兴趣劳动、 税收、 行政、 环境/能源法律领域。候选人应表现出 1) 良好的学术背景、 2) 的能力和承诺以卓越的奖学金，3) 的能力和承诺要有效的老师，愿意花时间在课外和学生一起工作。申请人必须包括一封求职信，表明该地区的兴趣和当前的履历和两个引用。显示出的能力，在教学面对面和在线跟踪记录的申请人，我们会额外考虑。教育法 》 已完成的系 7 名全职和 12 兼职教师和两名工作人员。KIMEP 大学是领先美式风格，国际上认可的讲英语的学术机构在独立国家联合体。它向所有学生和教师提供世界一流的学术经验和独特的国际环境。KIMEP 成立于 1992 年，建立了很强的区域声誉作为一家领先的高等教育。研究生和本科生的所有程序都是由至少一个被认可的国际认证机构都认可的。学术课程由国家机构在第一流的规定定期对估计。阿拉木图市位于雄伟的天山山脉在哈萨克斯坦东南部的基础。约 200 万人居住在或附近阿拉木图，因为它是金融、 文化、 夏季和冬季体育和国际资本的哈萨克斯坦。哈萨克斯坦位于欧亚大陆中心与弥合亚洲和欧洲的重要商业进军。拥有 21 世纪的丝绸之路，哈萨克斯坦提供石油和天然气、 经济发展和贸易中的独特地位。与过去十年增长四倍的过渡经济，哈萨克斯坦的动态变化的经济、 社会、 教育和文化环境提供重大和原始的研究令人难以置信的机会。等级和工资是竞争和经验和资历相称。补偿税后媲美西方国家薪金净额。有限的住校是可以租的。除了工资，福利包括基本医疗保障，KIMEP 课程，申请减免的学费率子女学校学费和搬迁津贴补贴。新教员提供第一学期期间减少的教学日程安排。夏季受薪的教学是通常可用的。将以下文件到 KIMEP 大学地址到任何问题，请提交︰ recruitment@kimep.kz 由申请人提供的个人资料将被保密，并只作招聘用途使用。只有合格的候选人将通知和邀请，并安排面试。位置保持打开状态，直到填充。

31 December 2016 further information

for the 18th time, the German Research Foundation (DFG) writes the "Communicator Award - Science Prize of the stifterverband für die Deutsche Wissenschaft". This personal prize is endowed with EUR 50 000 to scientists and awarded scientists from all disciplines who convey the results of their scientific work, as well as the their compartment in the media and the non-scientific public outstandingly. Awarded the dialogue between science and the public should be strengthened and recruited at the same time for it, that the mediation receives a higher priority of science as part of the work of scientists. The most important criteria for the awarding of the prize are the width and diversity as well as the originality and sustainability of mediation and dialog performance. Applications on a single project is not possible. Applicants must be active in the German-speaking world. The prize can be awarded on individual scientists as well as to a group of researchers. Larger units, such as departments or whole universities with their communication strategies are not included. Own applications as well as proposals for prizewinners are possible. The applications should contain informative documents about the mediation performance (up to 50 pages as a representative cross-section of the overall work, audiovisual contributions only a cassette or DVD, online blogs and other social media posts notes in the form of link). The written assessment of a second scientist or a scientist stands out clearly on the communication performance is required for auto applications. For each application, a curriculum vitae is requested in addition; specifically, scientific publication directories should not be annexed. Applications and proposals can - preferably in digital form - now to be submitted at the latest at the German research community, press and public relations, Kennedyallee 40, 53175 Bonn. A jury of communication scientists, journalists, PR professionals and selected scientists under the chairmanship of the Vice President of the DFG decides on the awarding of the prize. The selection and announcement of the winner is takes place in the spring of 2017, the awards ceremony on Monday, July 3, 2017, in the framework of the DFG annual meeting in Halle. Information about the price and the previous prize winners and winners under: contact person in the Clerk's Office of the DFG: Dr. Jutta Rateike, press and public relations, management public relations, Tel. + 49 228 885-2665

the young Academy at the Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences and the German Academy of natural scientists Leopoldina was founded in 2000 as the world's first Academy of outstanding young scientists. Their two main tasks are in the care of the scientific, especially interdisciplinary discourse and in the promotion of initiatives at the interface between science and society. The young Academy seeks to 1 January 2017 one/one

(code 16-22)

tasks: conditions: awaits you: 31 October 2016 < br / > < br / >

substantive and administrative support of interdisciplinary working groups and projects of the boys Academy, event organisation, supervision of publications (editing, organizing, publishing contracts), Committee work and work to Executive Committee and management, acquiring third-party funds. Degree, in-depth experiences in the science management, outstanding communication and language skills, very good knowledge of the science and research funding landscape, as well as the current science policy issues, experience in interdisciplinary research projects, pronounced organizational and teamwork, very good knowledge of English and a very good interaction with MS Office and databases. A nice, open team and the opportunity to gain diverse experience in the field of project and event management at the interface between science and society. It's a full-time job with 39 hours a week. The place is on the seat of the young Academy in Berlin. Employment and remuneration are based on the collective agreement of the public service (TVöD federal). With the appropriate qualifications, compensation is possible until the pay grade 13. The Office is limited to two years. Applications from severely disabled are considered primarily at equal fitness. Should this tender has aroused your interest, please apply only through our online application system to the under www.leopoldina.org/de/jobs. The call for proposals is subject to any budgetary restrictions. Application costs will not be refunded. the University of Bayreuth is a research-oriented University with internationally competitive and interdisciplinary research and teaching profile fields. At the University of Bayreuth is in the Faculty of biology in the civil servant subject to lifetime to fill a chemistry and Geosciences to the 1 April 2018. "Ecology and environmental sciences" is a profile field of the University of Bayreuth. The Chair should edit bio-geochemical processes in terms of interactions between soil, plant and/or soil-dwelling organisms and in terrestrial ecosystems investigate their impact on material flows. Experience in performing experimental laboratory and field work involving the use of stable / radioactive isotopes are desirable. Teaching Professor the subject of General soil science and soil ecology in the courses of geo-ecology (B.SC.., M.SC.), geography (B.SC..) and the international master courses represents environmental chemistry, global change ecology and environmental geography. The interdisciplinary cooperation at the Bayreuth Center for Ecology and environmental research (BayCEER) of the University of Bayreuth is expected. The setting preconditions apply for professors at the University of the free State of Bavaria (art. 7 and art. 10 par. 3 BayHSchPG). For more information, see www.uni-bayreuth.de (University / abroad). The University of Bayreuth aims to increase the share of women in research and teaching (in accordance with article 4 para 1 sentence 1 BayHSchG) and scientists urged to apply. Severely disabled are considered preferred at equal fitness. To increase the diversity of their Professor College, scholars and scientists who bring more diversity of the University of Bayreuth in the research and teaching profile, be asked to your application. Applicants with children are very welcome. The University of Bayreuth is certified as a family-friendly University, has successfully participated in the HRK-audit "Internationalisation of higher education" and offers a dual career support. Applications with the usual documents (CV with scientific career, testimonies, documents, bibliography, presentation of the scientific work areas directory of courses) are invited to the Dean of the Faculty of biology, chemistry and Geosciences, 95440 Bayreuth. The documents will not be returned after completion of the appeal, but irretrievably disposed of upon completion of the selection procedure in accordance with the requirements of data protection. In addition to the written application, we expect an identical copy of your application in just a PDF file (max. 30 MB) see dekanat.bcg@uni-bayreuth.de

博士 Gerit 伯恩鲍姆 博士 Wolfgang Dierking 不来梅港 122/G/CPI 2016 年 11 月 18 日 极地和海洋研究、 人力资源、 邮政信箱 120161、 27515 不来梅港阿尔弗雷德 · 韦格纳研究所亥姆霍兹中心

极地和海洋研究阿尔弗雷德 · 韦格纳研究所亥姆霍兹中心是由德国联邦共和国、 自由汉萨城不来梅和勃兰登堡州和石勒苏益格-荷尔斯泰因与大约 1000 名雇员支持的研究机构。我们经营极地和海洋研究中广泛的多学科方法，从而对全球环境、 地球系统和古气候学与众多大学和非大学研究机构合作作出重要贡献。我们"极地气象"节我们正在寻找 n 到 2017 年 3 月 1 日目前观察到的气候变化在北极冰的反照率反馈扮演重要的角色。这是除其他外由熔体水池塘在夏季海冰形成的影响。熔体池的影响有多大取决于厚度的冰，特别包括他们土地覆盖和他们的深度。在工作中，由熔化池从现有飞机数据确定物理性能指标。计划对海冰，互补陆基原位测量，以及测量的一架直升机，博士班的学生在参与。数据分析基于技术的图像处理和特殊的算法，应该进一步发展和在评价环境的优化。使用整体记录 / 医生 Andenin / 在作为确定的空间变异性和世俗的熔融池特性在北极地区发展的基础。（得到更多的实质性信息站点，在 gerit.birnbaum@awi.de），和 wolfgang.dierking@awi.de)。该网站是限于 3 年。公共服务的联邦政府 （其中联邦） 集体协议薪酬根据薪酬等级 13 （66%)。位置是我们提供灵活的工作时间、 现代研究设备和一流的基础设施与多学科国际和令人兴奋的工作环境。相同的专业和个人适用性的首选严重残疾的考生。兼容性，各项措施，具体由工作和家庭的支持。"工作和家庭"审计证书颁给我们，由于我们的家庭意识人才政策。作为博士生计划参与了结构化的博士课程或研究生院。在这方面，你将有机会参加亥姆霍兹研究生院极地和海洋研究 '尔玛' ( http://polmar.awi.de)。请发送您的应用程序通常下的文档 （简历、 证书和联系信息的两个专业相关的参考资料） 数量高达邮寄至︰ 或通过电子邮件 （合并在一个 PDF 文件中的所有文件） 到︰ personal@awi.de

Research Fellow/Senior Research Fellow

(Salary Level: approx. AUD A$98K - A$137K per year (plus 17% employer superannuation and leave loading)

Research Fellow/Senior Research Fellow: Atomic Electronics (Job Opening ID 56894):

Applications close:

The Australian Centre of Excellence for Quantum Computation & Communication Technology is the world’s largest team working to develop a scalable spin based quantum computing architecture in silicon. Headquartered in Sydney, the Centre is renowned internationally for its pioneering research in atomic manipulation, atomic electronics and high frequency cryogenic control of qubits in silicon. The Centre is expanding and offering unique research associate positions and PhD scholarships. Applications are sought from technically talented candidates with an ambition to create atomic-scale devices in silicon or germanium via high resolution STM-lithography and advanced semiconductor clean-room processing. Candidates should be ready to join a focused team to design, pattern and fabricate 3D devices where the active component is a single atom. Applications are only received via our website: www.jobs.unsw.edu.au . Search using the Job Opening ID: 56894. In addition to an outstanding academic record, candidates should possess enthusiasm, ambition, and cultural sensibilities to contribute as part of a vibrant team. These are full-time contract positions for two years and extendable to three years by mutual agreement. Applicants should systematically address the selection criteria. 31 October 2016

建筑与建成环境博士学位38 小时每周 (1 FTE) 终身制与可能性的地位欧元 3427 到 4691 欧元每月总额 110 年前成立以来最多、 建筑学院和建筑环境已建立了稳固的国际声誉，培训建筑师、 城市规划师和设计师，以及其研究投资组合和指导的博士生。与大约 2600年学生和 500 名工作人员成员，与大约 230 Fte 致力于学术的立场，我们的教师是最负盛名的建筑和建筑的环境学院之一和最大的代尔夫特科技大学之一全球。传统上，学院优先考虑设计高质量的培训和研究领域的建筑环境。超过 40 的椅子覆盖广泛的学术领域中设计、 工艺和技术，共同覆盖整个领域的建筑环境。学院拥有预算大约 € 3800 万，其中大约 € 700 万来源于间接和与第三方订立的合同。建筑学院和代尔夫特科技大学建成环境具有五个部门︰ 建筑学、 建筑工程 + 技术、 OTB、 城市规划，和房地产和住房。建筑系提供教育，并进行国际竞争水平的卓越的建筑和建筑设计领域的研究。椅子上的历史的建筑和城市规划中建筑系提供一个助理教授级的终身职位。椅子上历史建筑和城市规划与学院内的其他部门紧密合作和具有跨学科的设计和历史研究方案中举足轻重的地位。委员会是特别感兴趣将补充和建的椅子上，特别是在荷兰及欧洲建筑史与城市史，现任成员的专业知识同时还参加集体研究活动的助理教授。新教员将能够采取一个研究项目的发展中的主导作用。助理教授将工作跨越国际边界，承认网络的重要性和流动的体系结构和及其对建筑和城市形态的影响。质量的研究将在欧洲研究方案水平的竞争。助理教授将建筑与城市形态的长远发展上课的学士课程 （荷兰语或英语） 的基本课程 (Grondslagen/基础一、 二、 三) 的硕士和博士学位的方案，根据其个人的研究兴趣集中讲座专门主题 （用英语）。他/她还将监督硕士和博士学位的学生。职级和薪金等符合资格和专业经验。任期的轨道，导致与前景成为副教授或教授，长期任用进程提供年轻、 有才华的学者明确和有吸引力的职业生涯路径。在任期的轨道，你将有机会发展成为国际上的承认和认可的学术。我们提供一个结构化的职业和个人发展方案旨在提供个别学者可能尽可能多的支持。对于有关终身制和个人发展方案的详细信息，请访问 www.tudelft.nl/tenuretrack 申请人必须证明在建筑和/或城市的历史背景和相关学科的博士学位。应聘者预计将有一定的教学经验，致力于研究卓越学术刊物所示。他/她已发起和直接研究项目并获得外部资金的能力。应聘者具有良好的人际沟通技巧并能在大学一级的教学。此外，应聘者预计将有与国际关系网络以及科学的国际形象。书面英语和口语能力是必需的。荷兰人的知识是位置的欢迎但不是位置的必需在开始。一个任期轨道位置被提供六年。基于的性能指标商定在约会开始，将会作出决定，第五年是否为您提供永久的教职。工业大学提供一套定制的补偿方案、 健康保险和运动成员身份，折扣和每月的工作成本的贡献。可以安排灵活的工作安排。国际儿童中心提供儿童保育和国际小学。双重职业生涯服务向伴随伙伴提供支持。工资和福利是根据荷兰高校集体劳动协议。土代尔夫特设置教学工作人员的英语能力的具体标准。工业大学提供培训，以提高英语能力。鼓舞人心的良好教育是我们的中心目标。如果你有五年以上的经验，还没有您的教学证书，我们允许你达三年来获得此。有关这个职位的详细信息，请联系教授卡罗拉 Hein， atc.m.hein@tudelft.nl。要应用，寄一份详细的简历，三个引用，发布列表和出版物的样品连同申请 2016 年 12 月 1 日的一封信到卡萝 Coemans， HR-BK@tudelft.nl。我们将开始在 2016 年 12 月 1 日审查申请，并将继续直到职位招满。我们正计划在 2016 年 12 月和 1 月 2017年学院访问。我们期望新的同事，2 月 1 日至 2017 年 9 月 1 日开始。当申请这个职位，请参阅空缺编号 BK2016 30.

to occupy. The place is limited initially to the 31.12.2018. How will the Internet of the future look like? What well-known types of communication are preserved, what new must be considered in addition? What additional challenges represents the increasingly mobile use of networks? To sum it up: the challenge is a growing dynamism and range of variation of conditions, in increasingly diverse forms of use with steadily rising quality standards and a simple use of the variety of protocols. To meet this challenge, be in the collaborative research centre SFB funded by the German Research Foundation DFG 1053 "MAKI - multi mechanisms adaptation for the future Internet" < www.maki.tu-darmstadt.de > explore mechanisms in communication systems, their adaptation, interaction and continuous optimization and long-term development. Currently 14 professors/professors of different disciplines in three research areas, as well as more than 25 scientific staff/employee plus associated researchers / scientists, about 50 students and some renowned scholars/scientists of other universities are involved in the collaborative research center. In the framework of the collaborative research center, are responsible for all tasks to the organizational coordination of the collaborative and work to the spokesman of the special research area and the other bodies of the collaborative. You create, monitor and control the internal processes, the regular project meetings and the use of funds and act as a central contact person/contact for all researchers/scientists involved in the collaborative research center. The remuneration according to the collective agreement for the Technical University of Darmstadt (TV - TU Darmstadt). Part-time employment is possible. 工作领域︰

成功的候选人将固体物理系二 — — 数学和自然科学，技术合作大学柏林研究所的教授，同时也是一个独立的研究小组在夫琅和费海因里希 · 赫兹学院 (HHI) 的领袖.< br / > < br / >柏林技术大学和弗劳恩霍夫研究所电信，海因里希 · 赫兹研究所合作，研究与发展领域的超高速光电半导体器件和他们的应用程序。这一合作框架内两个伙伴想要加强的教学和研究领域的太赫兹波传感器。重点将是研究和开发的新设备和传感器的砷化铟镓磷化铟-材料高效生成和检测的太赫兹-辐射.< br / > < br / > 职位的候选人预计将充分参与学院二 — — 数学和自然科学的学位课程教学。在同一时间候选人行为将是一个独立的研究小组在夫琅和费海因里希 · 赫兹研究所 (HHI) 的领袖。

要求︰

  • 光电发电和探测 THz 辐射。
  • 微结构在 InP 材料。
  • 集成光学器件 （激光、 波导、 调制器） 太赫兹系统中使用的概念。
  • 射频工程、 触角和波导的设计。
  • 脉冲和连续波-太赫兹-计量及其工业应用领域。

工作的专业人员到俄罗斯莫斯科，俄罗斯阿尔法奖学金计划为期一年的奖学金计划是高级别国际筹资倡议，该倡议提供领导组织的国际经验和公司在俄罗斯每 18 年英国、 美国和德国初中高管。该程序被旨在从经济学、 金融、 新闻、 法律、 政策、 能源管理和类似的职业领域的参与者。方案的目标是美国、 英国和德国的专业人员、 深化跨文化交际技能和理解与俄罗斯的关系网络的扩展。阿尔法奖学金项目开始时在原籍国和随后的强化语言训练课程，从 6 月中旬在莫斯科的国家的个人语言培训。在夏季，研究员与公共和私营部门处理中俄罗斯当前主题的高级别代表参加了研讨会。在那之后，以既定的雇主，在俄罗斯，包括公司研究员工作媒体、 智库和基金会。候选人必须拥有大学学位，并在上述领域的经验。俄语语言技能那些不需要在时间的应用程序，但有益。该计划提供了慷慨的每月津贴、 语言培训、 与程序有关的旅行费用、 住宿和保险费用。申请截止日期为在程序 2017年-18 年结束你会发现下的在线申请表格︰ www.alfafellowship.org 为我们简报我们邀请你︰ 有关阿尔法研究金程序和应用程序进程的详细信息，您将收到在︰

部的营销与管理邀请一个或多个职位与具体责任教授作为战略组织设计中的应用程序。位置位于中欧登塞，以及从 2017 年 3 月 1 日或之后不久单位空置。教授是时间有限期限至 5 年并扩展的可能性。主要责任将重点研究和开发任务。战略组织设计中的研究集中在战略和组织科学的学术领域。我们的议程如涉及重要和有趣的解决的研究问题︰ 1) 聚合问题︰ 微观过程是如何影响组织的 macrobehavior？2） 的适应问题︰ 多层次的适应是如何使组织能够在动态环境中取得成功？3） 的战略设计问题︰ 即设计规则和适应哪些计划生成性能优越？4) 异质性问题︰ 非均质性种群的商业组织的来源是什么？我们正在寻找具有潜力，果断地将添加到此研究议程的候选人。成功的候选人将在全球顶级期刊上，最好是在学院的管理审查、 行政科学季刊、 管理科学、 组织科学或战略管理杂志等期刊有国际形象和良好的记录研究出版物。如果候选人不有顶尖期刊中发表的他们应该表现出意愿目的是为在国际上，最被认可的学术网点和有一个战略计划为实事求是在未来的几年内可实现这种目标在哪里了。成功的候选人将还有大量教学相关工作经验。候选人必须记录的教学资格和在发展和教学领域的创新能力。我们期待成功的申请者能够积极从事研究单位的发展，以及该署整体作出积极贡献。作为资深的学者，候选人预计处的社会和学术生活作出积极的贡献，以及参与指导的博士研究生和青年教师。我们也期望大学学术管理中的积极和建设性参与。为了满足这个职位的要求，候选人的选择，预计将定期亲临现场。除了研究论文发表记录和教学经验，候选人将有创纪录的学术和学者领导。候选人必须能够提供动态领导在研究和教学的发展，在取得外部研究资金，与国际研究界建立牢固的关系。候选人应提到的研究区内具有博士学位，并且预计将教和指导学生参加在企业战略和组织理论的学士和硕士课程。由于日益国际化的重点学位课程，申请人必须证明能力以英语授课。如果成功的申请人不是流利在丹麦，他或她预计将在大约两年的时间内学习丹麦语。研究部内的锚定在了解市场、 组织与个人之间的合作。它包含各种从进化模型的组织到新奇特形式的消费领域。它是新闻部的雄心，要在这些领域的国际前沿，并寻求研究、 教学和知识传播之间的协同作用。研究处组织的五个研究单位。请参阅超氧化物歧化酶网站 http://www.sod-research.com 和部门网站 http://www.sdu.dk/en/Om_SDU/Institutter_centre/I_marketing.aspx 更多详细信息。有关进一步信息，请联系电话 Thorbjørn，克努森教授: + 45 65503148 或发送电子邮件︰ tok@sam.sdu.dk 或部珍妮特 Lemmergaard 头电子邮件︰ jla@sam.sdu.dk 约会的位置将会按照财政部与丹麦专业协会联合会的工资协议。应用程序必须包括︰ 所有非丹麦文件必须翻译成英文。申请人申请教授请提交教学组合应用程序的文档以教学经验以及监督资格。可能发现正式申请表上的说明和指南，教学档案 在这里 申请将由评估委员会评估。委员会可能要求的其他信息，以及如果是这样，它负责申请人提供必要的材料。当评估委员会提交了报告时，申请人会收到有关他/她的评价的一部分。对于上述要求不完整的应用程序不会由委员会评估。这所大学鼓励所有感兴趣的人适用，不论年龄、 性别、 宗教信仰或种族背景。作为对申请人的资格进行综合评估的一部分，可进行采访。上传的文件必须在 （解锁） 的 Adobe PDF 或 Word 格式。每个字段只能包含单个文件的最大值。10 mb。你只可以申请通过我们的网站位置您的应用程序必须在 2016/10/31 在 23.59.59 上注册在我们的系统在最新的 CET。

Reference number:

 II-437/16 (starting at 01/04/17 / for a period of 3 years; an extension of 3 more years is possible after successful evaluation / closing date for applications 13/10/16)

Working field:

The position requires research and teaching and an internationally visible profile in the area of Stochastics.

The research focus of the position is expected to be in the area of Data Assimilation in Neuroscience. Furthermore, cooperations with the current professors at the Institute of Mathematics and with the Bernstein Center for Computational Neuroscience Berlin as well as participation in existing and future collaborative research projects of all mathematical institutes in Berlin (in particular Research Center MATHEON, Einstein Center for Mathematics ECMath, Berlin Mathematical School) are expected.

Teaching will be required in all mathematical degree programs and a moderate participation in the service teaching of mathematics for other programs. Teaching requirements shall be met in German and English. Candidates are expected to supervise student‘s theses as well as to participate in the academic administration of the university.

Requirements:



13/10/2016 reference number Fakultät II - Mathematik und Naturwissenschaften, Sekr. BEL 1, Marchstraße 6, 10587 Berlin

The junior professorship is to be funded in the context of the Einstein Center Digital Future. The professorship is offered under the reserve that funds are granted. Successful applicants must fulfill the requirements for appointment at the professor level in compliance with § 102a BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act), including a completed academic education in mathematics or a comparable subject, qualified achievements in research and a particular qualification for academic work normally attested by the excellent quality of a PhD, and pedagogical didactic qualifications, to be proven by teaching experience and visualized in a teaching portfolio (for further information see TUB Website , quick as no. 144242). Internationally visible research results in the area of Stochastics have to be proven through relevant publications. Experiences in acquiring and carrying out project alliances involving third-party funding are desirable. Applicants must have teaching experience at university level in the field of mathematics and in particular in the area of stochastics. Experience in the academic administration of the university is appreciated. Technische Universität Berlin strives to increase the proportion of women in research and teaching and therefore strongly encourages qualified female researchers to apply. Qualified individuals with disabilities will be favored. Technische Universität Berlin is a certified family-friendly higher education institution, and our Dual Career Service offers assistance to you and your family when relocating to Berlin. Please send your written application until with the and the usual documents to Technische Universität Berlin - Der Präsident -, . Please note that applications via email cannot be considered. Please send copies only. Original documents will not be returned. The vacancy is also available on the internet at

Reference number:

 2/1524/16

Working field:

In collaboration with other Berlin universities and research institutions, various aspects of the digital transformation will be explored. Within the Einstein Center Digital Future, new professors will strengthen the academic community of Berlin in the field of digitalization. In this context the Berlin University of the Arts has developed the Berlin Open Lab, a space for reflection and research, and a place of experimental digital fabrication in the design disciplines. New forms of interaction with technologies will be created and explored holistically as technological-economical-sociological artefacts.

Subject area:

Digital Education

Teaching responsibilities:

4 course hours (for the first 3 years, 6 course hours from the 4th year)

Job description:

Berlin Open Labs

Requirements:

written designation of the reference number October 13, 2016 by mail

The junior professorship is to be funded in the context of the Einstein Center Digital Future. The professorship is offered under the reserve that funds are granted. Instruction and research on digital education with an emphasis on user experience, HCI, interface/interaction design; artistic and academic reflection, research and experimental design testing of future educational media and networked digital education formats; active creation of the educational landscape and media on the basis of current findings in cognitive and perceptional psychology with testing and continued development of interface and interaction patterns, technologies and platforms; development of user-centred mediation options for digital education; development of a digital education discourse and network in a national and international context; establishment of the of the Berlin UdK in the framework of an interdisciplinary cooperation with partners from the Einstein Center Digital Future through new formats of instruction and research; cooperation in academic self administration. Academic degree in design or a related discipline, completed doctorate or years of artistic-academic research experience in interaction design or a related discipline with very good proficiency in the fields of HCI and UX design; relevant publications; pedagogical and didactical experience; experience in interdisciplinary and experimental design working methods; very good English language skills. Qualifications for employment in accordance with § 102a BerlHG. The Berlin University of the Arts is particularly committed to the employment and promotion of women; it follows the strategy of gender mainstreaming. Physically challenged persons with the appropriate qualifications will be given preferential consideration. Please indicate this circumstance in the application. Applications from persons with a migrant background who fulfil the qualifications for employment are encouraged. Please submit your application with informative application documents, under no later than to the Berlin University of Art - ZSD 1 -, Postbox 12 05 44, 10595 Berlin. For reasons of cost, the application documents can only be returned if a sufficient prepaid envelope is provided. Additional information is available under www.udk-berlin.de/universitaet/stellenausschreibungen/

敬业、 优秀的青年科学家和艺术家与跨学科的工作和活动在科学、 艺术和社会，准备好的年轻的学院，以介绍工作的五年之间的接口兴趣。 在年在全体会议三次 50 讲德语由来自成员包含科学和艺术的所有领域。您可以在项目中一起发现和工作组组织会议为例，发布定期的杂志和卷入政治科学讨论。穿的德意志学院 der Naturforscher 和柏林-勃兰登堡科学院提供年轻学院科学和艺术年轻结构和财政自由共同开发和设计创新的意念。更多的信息，请参阅 www.diejungeakademie.de 如果你有兴趣与你的想法积极在年轻的学院进行，你申请 2016年。 应用程序链接请在线与一封求职信、 简历、 出版物清单 / 工程，由两位老师的意见 / 教授到 11 月 30 日︰ www.diejungeakademie.de/zuwahl 计算机网络，间谍网络，运输网络，测试网络，生产和销售网络，社交网络在艺术、 科学、 政治神经网络...他们听到了什么？他们听起来？他们的历史是什么？谁与谁挂？谁加入？谁在听又有多少呢？谁纠缠吗？谁仍然养伤？什么仍然是看不见的但没有听说过？这个问题，年轻的学院想讨论网络和网络的社会、 政治、 经济、 艺术和技术的适用范围。截止日期︰ 2017 年 1 月 15 日类别︰ 每个类别的音响、 音像、 软件奖︰ EUR 5,000 的详细信息，请参阅 www.preisfrage2017.diejungeakademie.de

Reference number:

 2/1521/16

Working field:

In collaboration with other Berlin universities and research institutions, various aspects of the digital transformation will be explored. Within the Einstein Center Digital Future, new professors will strengthen the academic community of Berlin in the field of digitalization. In this context the Berlin University of the Arts has developed the Berlin Open Lab, a space for reflection and research, and a place of experimental digital fabrication in the design disciplines. New forms of interaction with technologies will be created and explored holistically as technological-economical-sociological artefacts.

Subject area:

Internet of Things

Teaching responsibilities:

4 course hours (for the first 3 years, 6 course hours from the 4th year)

Job description:

Berlin Open Lab

Requirements:

written designation of the reference number October 13, 2016 by mail

The junior professorship is to be funded in the context of the Einstein Center Digital Future. The professorship is offered under the reserve that funds are granted. Instruction and research on concepts of interaction design related to the Internet of things as new forms of human-technology interaction; testing and development of creative/experimental and technological prototypes of networked systems (hardware and software); artistic and academic reflection of the technological evolution and its consequences in the field of Physical Computing, Interaction Design and the Internet of things; establishment of the at UdK cooperating with partners from the Einstein Center Digital Future through new formats of teaching and research; participation in academic self administration. Completed degree in higher education in design or a related field, completed doctorate or several years of experience in artistic-academic research in the field of design research or a related discipline; relevant list of publications; paedagogical and didactical skills and experience; very good English language skills. Qualifications for employment in accordance with § 102a BerlHG. The Berlin University of the Arts is particularly committed to the employment and promotion of women; it follows the strategy of gender mainstreaming. Physically challenged persons with the appropriate qualifications will be given preferential consideration. Please indicate this circumstance in the application. Applications from persons with a migrant background who fulfil the qualifications for employment are encouraged. Please submit your application with informative application documents, under no later than to the Berlin University of Art - ZSD 1 -, Postbox 12 05 44, 10595 Berlin. For reasons of cost, the application documents can only be returned if a sufficient prepaid envelope is provided. Additional information is available under www.udk-berlin.de/universitaet/stellenausschreibungen/

< br / > < br / > 50 000 euro for the best teaching of science in the media and public 31 December 2016 further information

for the 18th time, the German Research Foundation (DFG) writes the "Communicator Award - Science Prize of the stifterverband für die Deutsche Wissenschaft". This personal prize is endowed with EUR 50 000 to scientists and awarded scientists from all disciplines who convey the results of their scientific work, as well as the their compartment in the media and the non-scientific public outstandingly. Awarded the dialogue between science and the public should be strengthened and recruited at the same time for it, that the mediation receives a higher priority of science as part of the work of scientists. The most important criteria for the awarding of the prize are the width and diversity as well as the originality and sustainability of mediation and dialog performance. Applications on a single project is not possible. Applicants must be active in the German-speaking world. The prize can be awarded on individual scientists as well as to a group of researchers. Larger units, such as departments or whole universities with their communication strategies are not included. Own applications as well as proposals for prizewinners are possible. The applications should contain informative documents about the mediation performance (up to 50 pages as a representative cross-section of the overall work, audiovisual contributions only a cassette or DVD, online blogs and other social media posts notes in the form of link). The written assessment of a second scientist or a scientist stands out clearly on the communication performance is required for auto applications. For each application, a curriculum vitae is requested in addition; specifically, scientific publication directories should not be annexed. Applications and proposals can - preferably in digital form - now to be submitted at the latest at the German research community, press and public relations, Kennedyallee 40, 53175 Bonn. A jury of communication scientists, journalists, PR professionals and selected scientists under the chairmanship of the Vice President of the DFG decides on the awarding of the prize. The selection and announcement of the winner is takes place in the spring of 2017, the awards ceremony on Monday, July 3, 2017, in the framework of the DFG annual meeting in Halle. Information about the price and the previous winners and prize-winners at: www.dfg.de/communicator-preis contact person in the Clerk's Office of the DFG: Dr. Jutta Rateike, press and public relations, management public relations, jutta.rateike@dfg.de Tel. + 49 228 885-2665

哈莉研究所的经济研究 （设定该） — — 莱布尼兹协会会员提供在金融市场部部 (教授博士迈克尔 Koetter)，在 2017 年 1 月 1 日开始。合同最初将限于三年。就业的地方是哈雷 (Saale)。

我们的提供︰ 你将嵌入在国际、 刺激，和合作研究环境与优良的基础设施。哈莉研究所的经济研究 （设定该） — — 莱布尼兹协会会员与国家和国际科学社区和提供优良的机会获得学历息息相关。你会进行自己的研究领域的金融系统、 银行业务和目标在顶级期刊上发表的非常规货币政策行动的影响。在现有协定与合作大学中，还有可能获得教学经验。 您的配置文件 / 你的动机︰你在金融经济学中有一个优秀的背景和应用微观计量经济学。你感兴趣主题有关的金融和增长、 银行业监管和银行的关系。您在当代的计量经济学和统计方法，以确定因果效应进行了实证经验。您还可以记录发表在顶级普遍感兴趣的目标的创新性研究论文和经济学和金融学领域期刊。你都能够理解复杂的问题和结构化的方式进行沟通。你喜欢在国际团队工作和感也运送科学研究到社会政策的影响。

我们的期望︰ 你已成功地完成你博士经济学或金融以优异的成绩或接近它。你表现出浓厚的兴趣，在实证研究中，将独立进行研究。你贡献链接处与国家和国际科学界，与其他设定该部门合作并支持博士研究生。 进一步信息︰设定该认为自己是一个家庭友好型雇主，保障妇女和男子平等机会并特此强烈鼓励妇女申请这个职位。薪酬及福利对应于德国公共部门薪酬方案 （到工资组 13 Tarifvertrag der 州电视-L)。残疾人和他们的同龄人的候选人是鼓励以指示在其应用程序中的严重残疾。

应用程序︰ jobs@iwh-halle.de Kristin.Huettner@iwh-halle.de Michael.Koetter@iwh-halle.de

你的简历和个人简历的所有资格的证据应当以电子方式在单个 pdf 文件中，注明 2016年-14 由 2016 年 10 月 30 日向 jobs@iwh-halle.de。如有查询，请联络女士克里斯汀系列并且 （ Kristin.Huettner@iwh-halle.de，电话 + 49 345 7753 831） 或部门负责人教授博士迈克尔 Koetter （ Michael.Koetter@iwh-halle.de，电话 + 49 345 7753 727）。

at the Institute of mathematics and image computing of the University of Lübeck is a place of a soon to be filled. The point is the BMBF research project "dynamic medical imaging: modeling and analysis of medical data for improved diagnosis, monitoring, and drug development (MED4D)" associated and initially limited to 30 November 2019. MED4D is a collaborative project to the dynamical imaging of the universities of Bochum, Lübeck and Münster. The goal is the development and research on mathematical model for the analysis of 4-D medical imaging data. Specifically, it involves models of movement correction and the description of dynamics and their repatriation on clinically relevant parameters. We expect a PhD in mathematics or a related subject and a strong background in the areas of image processing differential equations, optimization or mathematical modeling, ordinary and partial. Your tasks in the project include the analysis and implementation of parameterized dynamic models and motion models and their coupling. Further, you will receive the possibility to distinguish themselves in the areas of teaching and supervision of qualification work. It is expected a lively publication performance on an international level. The Institute of mathematics and image computing deals with mathematical issues (optimization, variational calculus, partial differential equations) in the field of medical image processing and thus offers an ideal research environment. Further, the Institute also with Fraunhofer MEVIS is associated to the Lübeck. This special combination offers excellent opportunities for international and regional cooperation. In a friendly and open-minded work environment, you find a very well equipped technical infrastructure as well as excellent professional and personal design and development possibilities at us. The Halle Institute for Economic Research (IWH) – Member of the Leibniz Association is offering a at the Department of Financial Markets department (Professor Dr Michael Koetter), starting on January 1, 2017. The contract will initially be limited to three years. The place of employment is Halle (Saale).

What we offer: You will be embedded in an international, stimulating, and cooperative research environment with an excellent infrastructure. The Halle Institute for Economic Research (IWH) – Member of the Leibniz Association is closely linked with the national and international scientific community and offers excellent opportunities to gain academic qualifications. You will conduct own research in the fields of financial systems, banking and the effects of unconventional monetary policy actions with the goal to publish in top journals. In the context of existing agreements with collaborating universities, there is the possibility to gain teaching experience. Your profile/Your motivation: You have an excellent background in financial economics and applied microeconometrics. You are interested in topics related to finance and growth, banking regulation, and relationship banking. You are experienced with contemporary econometric and statistical methods to identify causal effects empirically. You also have a record of innovative research papers that aim to be published in top general interest and field journals of economics and finance. You are able to comprehend complex issues and communicate them in a structured way. You like to work in an international team and are interested also transporting the policy implications of scientific research to society.

What we expect: You have successfully completed your PhD in economics or finance with excellent results or are close to it. You demonstrated a strong interest in empirical research and will conduct research independently. You contribute to linking the department with the national and international scientific community, cooperating with other IWH departments, and supporting PhD students. Further information: The IWH considers itself a family-friendly employer that guarantees equal opportunities for women and men and hereby strongly encourages women to apply for this position. Remuneration and benefits correspond to the German public sector salary scheme (up to pay group 13 Tarifvertrag der Länder, TV-L). Candidates with disabilities and their peers are encouraged to indicate a severe disability in their application.

Application procedure: jobs@iwh-halle.de Kristin.Huettner@iwh-halle.de Michael.Koetter@iwh-halle.de

Your resume and CV with evidence of all qualifications should be addressed electronically in a single pdf file with indication 2016-14 by October 30, 2016 to jobs@iwh-halle.de . For inquiries, please contact Ms. Kristin Hüttner ( Kristin.Huettner@iwh-halle.de , Tel +49 345 7753 831) or the department head Professor Dr Michael Koetter ( Michael.Koetter@iwh-halle.de , Tel +49 345 7753 727).

项目"数字空间"的研究校园 Mobility2Grid (M2G) 探讨能源和运输系统的通信作为收敛性的一个关键因素︰ M2G 意味着两个系统相关至今很大程度上分离︰ 能源和流动性。车辆与能源网络交互都需要在系统之间交换信息。这种通信的不同的系统与用户和不同级别的用户的组织，是所有伙伴的 TF6 中央研究的问题。七区开发 M2G 平台工具集与其合作伙伴进一步发展到结构化和隐私兼容收集、 存储和处理数据的评价、 分析、 预测等。为此我们正在寻找一个支持我们在收集和整理有关的要求和第条的当前状态的人来说

the Dr. Theo and Friedl Schöller research centre of the Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg serves the strengthening of good governance in business and society. The effort, by means of dialogue and projects is the strategic focus of the science at the heart "create cohesion - shaping change - implement innovation" to take the University of Erlangen Nuremberg and Nuremberg cutting-edge research in an international context to connect. For fellowships in the Department of Economics in the following category are written out for the year 2017 again: the Schöller Research Center presents its fellows resources amounting to maximum €20,000 per Schöller Fellow to carry out a research project at the disposal. The fellows are encouraged to bring their experience and expertise in the Department of economics. Applications are requested by mail (in the original) and at the same time via email (in copy) to the Board of Directors of the Schöller Research Centre. The application form and further information about the advertised fellowships are retrievable on the Internet site of the Research Center. Reference number:

 VII-449/16 (starting at the earliest possible / for a period of 3 years; an extension of 3 more years is possible after successful evaluation / closing date for applications 13/10/16)

Working field:

The position includes teaching and research duties in the area of "Trust in digital services", with a special focus on managerial, economic and legal strategies for increasing trust in digital technologies and services. Applicants should have expertise in at least one of the following research areas or related fields:
  • Formation and facilitation of trust in digital services (in particular trust-building factors, incentive and management systems)
  • Legal and regulatory developments in data privacy and protection
  • reputation systems, review systems, certificates, intermediaries or trust networks
  • Strategies for cyber security
  • Training and education activities to create trust between providers and users
  • Organization of horizontal and vertical value chains for digital services
Teaching in the bachelor and master degrees Industrial Engineering and Management, Business Informatics, ICT Innovation, Innovation Management and Entrepreneurship, Sustainable Management and Industrial and Network Economics. Classes should be taught in German and English

Requirements:

written application reference number until 13/10/2016 Dekan der Fakultät VII, Sekr. H 30, Straße des 17. Juni 135, 10623 Berlin

The junior professorship is to be funded in the context of the Einstein Center Digital Future. The professorship is offered under the reserve that funds are granted. Candidates must meet the requirements of the Berlin Higher Education Act (§102a BerlHG), including a completed academic education, qualified achievements in research, usually proven by an outstanding doctoral thesis (PhD), educational and didactic competences. We are seeking a scientist with experience in empirical and/or qualitative applied research and in publications in international journals. Technische Universität Berlin strives to increase the proportion of women in research and teaching and therefore strongly encourages qualified female researchers to apply. Qualified individuals with disabilities will be favored. Technische Universität Berlin is a certified family-friendly higher education institution, and our Dual Career Service offers assistance to you and your family when relocating to Berlin. Please send your with the and the usual documents (CV, educational degree, certificates and/or diplomas, references, works considered relevant for the application, and a research and teaching plan) to Technische Universität Berlin - Der Präsident -, Please send copies only. Original documents will not be returned. The vacancy is also available on the internet at

The Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Berlin for three years, with employment contract. Deadline for submission: 30 November 2016 (23:59 CET)
  • Cover letter, (indicating in which project your are interested).
  • Curriculum vitae including list of publications.
  • research prospectus (maximum 750 words).
  • sample of writing.
  • names and contact details of at least two referees.

Department III, Artefacts, Action, and Knowledge, Director: Prof Dagmar Schäfer, seeks The positions are in close conjunction with the research agenda of Dept. III ( https://www.mpiwg-berlin.mpg.de/en/research/projects/departmentschaefer ). Outstanding junior scholars with suitable experience in science-, technology-, economic history, STS, anthropology, regional studies or other relevant fields are invited to apply. Candidates should hold a doctorate in the history of science or related field at the time the position begins (PhD achieved in 2015 or later), and be able to show evidence of scholarly excellence in the form of initial international publications. Research projects should relate to the two major projects currently pursued at the Department: Histories of Planning ( https://www.mpiwg-berlin.mpg.de/en/research/projects/depart­mentSchaefer_HistoriesOfPlanning and The Body of Animals ( https://www.mpiwg-berlin.mpg.de/en/research/projects/departmentSchaefer_Animals ). The Max Planck Institute for the History of Science is an international and interdisciplinary research institute ( http://www.mpiwg-berlin.mpg.de/en/index.html ). Postdoctoral fellows are expected to participate in the research activities of the Institute, and to present their own work and discuss that of others fluently in English. Applications may be submitted in German, English, Chinese or French. The positions are primarily devoted to research, with no teaching. Remuneration is based on the TVöD-Bund pay scales (E13). Candidates of all nationalities are invited to apply; applications from women are especially welcome. The Max Planck Society is committed to promoting handicapped individuals and encourages them to apply. Candidates are requested to submit their applications online using the following link: Note that only electronic submissions will be accepted. Only successful candidates will be notified. Your application should contain - uploaded as 1 PDF document: For questions concerning the research project and Department III, please contact Prof Dagmar Schäfer ( dschaefer@mpiwg-berlin.mpg.de ); for technical questions regarding the application portal, for administrative questions concerning the position and the Institute, please first contact the Department secretary ( schaeferoffice@mpiwg-berlin.mpg.de ). Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Boltzmannstraße 22, 14195 Berlin, Germany

jutta.schwarzkopf@ikz-berlin.de October 31, 2016, personal@ikz-berlin.de

The position is limited to three years. Payment is according to TVöD (Treaty for German public service). IKZ is an equal opportunity employer. Therefore, female candidates are encouraged to apply and will be preferred in case of adequate qualification. Among equally qualified applicants preference will be given to disabled candidates. For information about the project contact: Dr. Jutta Schwarzkopf, jutta.schwarzkopf@ikz-berlin.de , Phone +49 30 6392-3053. Please submit your application via email by to personal@ikz-berlin.de

The Leibniz Institute for Crystal Growth (IKZ) is a leading research institution in the area of crystal growth of technologically important materials for micro-, opto- and powerelectronics, sensors, optics and laser technology. This ranges from explorative fundamental research to pre-industrial development. It is part of Forschungsverbund Berlin and a member of the Leibniz Association. You may find more details at www.ikz-berlin.de Commencing as soon as possible there is an opening for a for the topic: The group "Ferroelectric oxide layers" of the IKZ deals with epitaxially grown complex oxide films. SrTiO as a prototype of perovskite oxide is of particular interest. Despite many experimental and theoretical efforts, the fundamental understanding of growth process and related defects, oxygen vacancies and interface phenomena is still limited yet. Therefore, within the Leibniz ScienceCampus GraFox, SrTiO thin films shall be basically investigated in dependence of growth parameters and choice of the substrate (lattice strain). Systematic studies on point defects, electronic transport mechanisms, role of hydrogen and interface formation shall be performed. The method of choice for the epitaxial deposition is focused mainly on the metal organic chemical vapor deposition (MOCVD), which provides stoichiometric films with low defect density. Additionally, pulsed laser deposition will be used, where a large range of deposition parameters is available. Characterization of the thin films shall be performed by x-ray diffraction and electron microscopy as well as atomic force microscopy equipped with a conductive (CAFM) module. Applicants should hold a Diploma or a MSc degree in physics, chemistry, materials science or a related discipline as well as good English language skills. Expertise in the field of oxides/perovskites, thin film growth or knowledge regarding thin film characterization is highly desirable. Capability of working scientifically on an independent basis and ability to carry out structured scientific work within a highly motivated team of researchers and technicians are further requirements. The position is part of the Leibniz ScienceCampus "Growth and fundamentals of oxides for electronic applications (GraFox)", which seizes to fuse the excellent individual activities and competences in Berlin on one of the most prospective material systems for future electronic and (renewable) energy applications. Through collaborative research and publications we aim to establish an internationally renowned key region in Berlin. The ScienceCampi of the Leibniz Association promote cooperation on an equal footing between Leibniz institutions and universities in the form of thematically-focused, complementary regional partnerships. These networks aim to strengthen the scientific environment for the relevant themes by conducting strategic research and encouraging interdisciplinarity in their topics, projects and methods.

第一次 3 年占据。正面评价是一种扩展就业共 6 年。网站所有者 / 任职是独立地代表德国在东欧特别是对其社会和经济的网络，在研究和教学，在德累斯顿技术大学船锚广泛的社会和经济历史系。所需的 BKMJuniorprofessur 工作中的情感历史观点列入。她和 er 进行研究的德国人在东欧的历史以及作为刺激适用交织而成的历史和网络研究的特定方法。它是对重点推广的青年科学家尤为重要。假定在学术自我管理的参与。预期与研究所合作学院哲学和语言、 文学和文化的研究以及研究极权主义，索布族学会 e.V./Serbski 系另外是历史的与德累斯顿概念合作伙伴 （如军事历史博物馆的德国联邦国防军，德意志卫生博物馆） 撒克逊历史和民间传说，汉娜研究所 AB 研究所研究所在包岑其他合作领域和伙伴的德国人在东欧地区发展和扩大。仍然，应深化和显式扩展到史角度的德国人在中央，南-东欧国家与东欧国家的伙伴机构现有的科研合作。假定是愿意参与的合作项目，并开始实施的项目，特别是 19 世纪和 20 世纪以来，德国人在东欧国家的社会和经济网络的历史。申请人必须是欧洲一直高于平均水平的成功历史的主体和证明的出版物和中部、 东南部地区或东部历史课程获得博士学位。她 / 儿有处理中的研究和教学与德国人在东欧国家的历史和社会或经济历史的问题，特别是到 19 世纪和 20 世纪。利率在当前的历史、 文化、 语言和/或社会科学理论和问题，特别是网络和分析的情感，以及跨学科合作是理想的做法。先决条件是东欧中亚、 东南亚或东欧语言和德语水平 b2 的安全控制。管理科学团队的经验，深入了解一个国家从东欧国家以及第三方资金的经验是可取的。预计的意愿和能力在英语授课。根据 SächsHSFG 第 63 条规定调整条件。德累斯顿工业大学提供程序旨在具体满足初级教授和助理教授。特别是，小辈教授助理教授支持和网络会议，指导程序，和继续教育方案和个别辅导。德累斯顿工业大学已进一步取得资格的初级教授或初级教授的关注。如果需要机会去康复程序在于教师。详细信息请参阅︰ https://tu-dresden.de/forschung/wissenschaftlicher-nachwuchs/nach-der-promotion/juniorprofessur 德累斯顿工业大学试图增加教授和妇女的比例因此呼吁明确，申请。严重残疾的应用是特别受欢迎。大学是一个认证的家庭友好型大学和具有双重职业服务。如果你有这些或相关主题的问题，是教师的平等机会主任 (博士 Hermann 迪贝尔菲舍尔 + 49 351 463 36389) 和残疾人士的沉重表示形式 (夫人吉瑞特，电话: + 49 351 463 33175) 喜欢谈谈可用。请将您的简历必须包含的科学事业、 科学作品列表、 课程目录、 双面的素描三至五个关于历史的德国人在 19 世纪和 20 世纪，在东欧国家的社会和经济网络的研究项目，以及达最高学历证书的核证的副本的表示形式的应用程序 （它是枸德累斯顿工业大学的邮戳） 上:

格奥尔格-8 月-大学哥廷根

格奥尔格-8 月-大学哥廷根成立于 1737 年和是一项具有国际意义的研究大学，重视研究为基础的教学。在十三个院系，拥有超过 29000 学生入学，其中是略低于 11%来自国外。它是表明国际吸引力，传统上认为，高比例的国际科学家与大学。提供的课程的特点是极好的研究条件，以及各种人文和社会科学只出席在德国的几个大学学科。格鲁吉亚奥古斯塔是哥廷根校园的一部分作为密切与相关优秀非大学研究环境.

在格奥尔格-8 月-大学哥廷根印度现代研究中心是 15.01.2017 网站的一个科学助理 / 科学 DFG 优先程序框架内的员工"审美眩晕︰ 时间和多彩的现代性中的代表性"填补有 75%的定期平均每周工作时间 (zzt。 29.85 小时/周)，为期三年。费用支付 13 电视-L 支付等级。除了研究项目工作标题与工作任务之间"宗教时代，媒体流派技术实施︰ 视听媒体实践之间在海德拉巴的什叶派人种学研究"跨学科研究组对媒体和公众在高校教学管理系统中的参与。关于高校教学管理系统的详细信息是可用下下面的链接︰ https://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/131257.html 对有关重点项目的详细信息都可以在下面的链接︰ http://www.aesthetische-eigenzeiten.de/ 申请人应带以下资格条件:-特别是合格的促销或特别是合格的硕士。 学位领域的民族学、 社会学、 南亚研究或相关的学科-准备为高校教学管理系统-第 DFG 项目和跨学科的研究小组对媒体和公众参与是流畅的乌尔都语/印度斯坦语有利地方的资格学者用，并提供促进或矿山投资的可能性。哥廷根大学寻求的地区哪里妇女代表，并敦促因此合格妇女申请的妇女的百分比增加。它还将自己视为家庭友好型大学并促进科学工作 — 家庭平衡。这所大学有即定的目标，更多严重残疾的人士就业。严重残疾申请得到优先具有相同的资格。请把您的应用程序与通常的文档 （求职信、 简历、 样品或杂志上的文章） 送到 07.11.2016 组合在一起在一个 PDF 文件通过电子邮件到 patrick.eisenlohr@cemis.uni-goettingen.de。同行评审的出版物在甄选过程中拥有较高的优先级。请直接向先生教授帕特里克 · Eisenlohr 任何问题 (电子邮件︰ patrick.eisenlohr@cemis.uni-goettingen.de)。有关网站的教授 Eisenlohr http://www.uni-goettingen.de/en/356233.html 更多信息。

Reference number:

 II-436/16 (starting at 01/04/17 / for a period of 3 years; an extension of 3 more years is possible after successful evaluation / closing date for applications 13/10/16)

Working field:

The position requires research and teaching and an internationally visible profile in the area of Discrete Optimization.

The research focus of the position is expected to be a branch of Discrete Optimization at the interface with the area of Algorithms for Big Data. Furthermore, co-operations with the current professors at the Institute of Mathematics as well as participation in existing and future collaborative research projects of all mathematical institutes in Berlin (Research Center MATHEON, Einstein Center for Mathematics Berlin, Berlin Mathematical School etc.) are expected.

Teaching will be required in all mathematical degree programs and moderately in the service teaching of mathematics for other programs. Teaching requirements shall be met in German and English. Candidates are expected to supervise students‘ theses as well as to participate in the academic administration of the university.

Requirements:



13/10/2016 reference number Mathematik und Naturwissenschaften, Sekr. BEL 1, Marchstraße 6, 10587 Berlin

The junior professorship is to be funded in the context of the Einstein Center Digital Future. The professorship is offered under the reserve that funds are granted. Successful applicants must fulfill the requirements for appointment at the professor level in compliance with § 102a BerlHG (Berlin Higher Education Act), including a completed academic education in mathematics or a comparable subject, qualified achievements in research and a particular qualification for academic work normally attested by the excellent quality of a PhD, and pedagogical didactic qualifications, to be proven by teaching experience and visualized in a teaching portfolio (for further information see TUB Website , quick as no. 144242). Internationally visible research results in the area of Discrete Optimization have to be proven through relevant publica tions. Experience in acquiring and carrying out projects and project alliances involving third-party funding are desirable. Technische Universität Berlin strives to increase the proportion of women in research and teaching and therefore strongly encourages qualified female researchers to apply. Qualified individuals with disabilities will be favored. Technische Universität Berlin is a certified family-friendly higher education institution, and our Dual Career Service offers assistance to you and your family when relocating to Berlin. Please send your written application until with the and the usual documents to Technische Universität Berlin - Der Präsident -, Fakultät II - . Please note that applications via email cannot be considered. Please send copies only. Original documents will not be returned. The vacancy is also available on the internet at

Position Summary Minimum Qualifications
  • PhD or JD in a law or related field from a recognized, accredited university, at time of application;.
  • Fluent in English;.
  • Record of on-going research engagement or strong publication potential.
Preferred Qualifications: The School of Law KIMEP University Almaty, Kazakhstan

st Compensation Application Process

HR portal:
  • Filled and submitted application form.
  • Cover letter that indicates the position applied, how you meet the minimum and preferred qualifications, course(s) you can teach, and salary expectations.
  • Short-listed candidates are required to submit 2 recommendation letters.
Closing date for submission of applications: December 1, 2016

KIMEP University School of Law POSITION DESCRIPTION Assistant Professor or Associate Professor (Effective 16 August 2017) KIMEP School of Law seeks applications from entry-level candidates with excellent academic records and demonstrated potential for outstanding teaching and scholarship, and applications from junior-lateral candidates possessing outstanding academic credentials, demonstrated teaching ability, and distinguished scholarship to begin in the 2017-2018 academic year. Rank as either Assistant or Associate Professor of Law depends upon experience and is subject to faculty and university approval. Our hiring needs are flexible, though we have a particular interest in tax, corporate law/finance/banking areas (international), intellectual property, international trade (WTO), Kazakhstan domesticate law in customs, labor, tax, administrative, environmental/energy law areas. Candidates should demonstrate 1) a strong academic background, 2) a capacity for and commitment to excellence in scholarship, and 3) a capacity for and commitment to be an effective teacher and a willingness to spend time outside of class working with students. Applicants must include a cover letter indicating the area of interest and current curriculum vitae, and two references. Applicants with track record of demonstrated competence in teaching face to face and online will be given extra consideration. The School of Law has an accomplished faculty of 7 full-time and 12 adjunct faculty and two staff. KIMEP University is the leading American-style, internationally-accredited, English-speaking academic institution in the Commonwealth of Independent States. It provides a world-class academic experience and a unique inter­national environment to all its students and faculty. KIMEP was established in 1992 and has built a very strong regional reputation as a leading provider of higher education. All graduate and undergraduate programs are accredited by at least one recognized international accre­dit­ation agency. Academic programs are regularly rated in the top rank of provision by national bodies. The city of Almaty is situated at the base of majestic Tien Shan Mountains in Southeast Kazakhstan. About 2 million people live in or near Almaty because it is the financial, cultural, summer and winter sports and cosmo­politan capital of Kazakhstan. Kazakhstan is located in the heart of Eurasia with important commercial inroads bridging Asia and Europe. Boasting the Silk Road of the 21 century, Kazakhstan offers unique po­sit­ions in oil and gas, economic development, and trade. With a transitioning economy that has witnessed four-fold growth over the past decade, Kazakhstan's dynamically changing economic, social, educational and cultural environment provides incredible opportunities for significant and original research. Rank and salary are competitive and commensurate with experience and qualifications. Compensation after-tax compares favorably with net salaries in western countries. Limited on-campus housing is available to rent. In addition to salary, a benefits package includes basic healthcare, reduced tuition rates for KIMEP courses, subsidy for children's school tuition and relocation allowance. New faculty members are provided with a reduced teaching schedule during the first semester. Summer paid teaching is typically available. Please submit the following documents to KIMEP University Address any questions to: recruitment@kimep.kz Personal data provided by applicants will be kept confidential and used for recruitment purpose only. Only short-listed candidates will be informed and invited for interviews. The position remains open until filled.

Employer Job description Requirements
  • PhD degree in a relevant field of Behavioural and Social Sciences, preferably Educational Sciences, on a topic relevant for the position.
  • evidence of research expertise in the domain of learning & instruction.
  • affinity with evidence based education.
  • publications in international peer-reviewed scientific journals.
  • evidence of teaching and student supervision (lectures, theses).
  • evidence of designing new courses and/or (parts of) a new programme.
  • experience with internationalization in higher education.
  • holds the Dutch University Teaching Qualification or has the willingness to obtain this qualification within the first years of the contract.
  • command of the English language at C1 level evidenced by publications in peer-reviewed international journals and presentations at conferences.
  • experience with attracting research funding.
  • leadership competences and a team player with good communication skills.
  • the ability to communicate verbally and in written form in Dutch or to learn Dutch if necessary within the first years of the contract.
Conditions of employment Application Applicants are requested to submit: Contract type: Employer Department Additional information

Groningen, Broerstraat 5 Professors, associate professors, assistant professors and lecturers Behaviour and Society 38.0 hours per week maximum € 5330 University Graduate 216286 University of Groningen The Assistant Professor position is situated within the Department of Educational Sciences / Groningen Institute for Educational Research (GION). This department is responsible for teaching at bachelor and master level. At bachelor level, this includes the Bachelor Educational Sciences and the Academic Bachelor for Primary School Teachers, a joint programme of the department and three higher education institutes. At master level, this includes the Master Educational Sciences including an international track ’Evidence based education’, and the Research Master for the behavioural and social sciences. Within the department research is conducted on learning environments, evidence based education, determinants of school success, and innovation and citizenship. The position includes research, teaching and organisational & management tasks. The Assistant Professor will contribute to research in the domain of learning & instruction with a focus on early childhood education. Research encompasses 50% of the position and this includes the supervision of PhD students. The position consists for 50% of teaching in the various bachelor and master programmes (e.g., lectures, seminars, internships, theses, and coordination) with an emphasis on learning & instruction and evidence based education. The management task concerns the coordination of the master track Evidence Based Education. The appointee should meet the following minimum requirements for Assistant Professor (UD) as laid out in the Faculty’s tenure track policy: The University of Groningen offers a salary depending on qualifications and work experience. For candidates at the Assistant Professor level the salary for a fulltime position ranges from a minimum of € 3,427 (salary scale 11 Dutch Universities) to a maximum of € 5,330 (salary scale 12) gross per month. The gross salary is excluding 8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus and participation in a pension scheme for employees. Favourable tax agreements may apply to non-Dutch applicants. You will be appointed for a fixed-period of six years, on the condition of a positive mid-term evaluation in the third year of employment (please note that if you have had a previous appointment at the University of Groningen, the length of the employment may be more limited due to legal constraints). After a positive final evaluation in the sixth year of employment, you will be granted tenure to Associate Professor. Applicants are advised to consult the criteria of the Tenure Track system, see: www.rug.nl/gmw/research/tenure-track-notitie-gmw-2015-door-cvb-goedgekeurd-uk-0508.pdf For a detailed overview on the conditions of employment please visit: www.rug.nl/about-us/work-with-us/that-is-why/conditions-employment The position is fulltime (1.0 fte). An appointment of 0.8 fte is possible. We expect the candidate to start as soon as possible. Please send your complete application (in English) as a single PDF file until 20 October / 21 October 2016 (Dutch local time), by means of the application form (click on ’Apply’ below on the advertisement on the university website). Please upload your application as ’letter of motivation’ and include the vacancy number at the start of your application. 1. A cover letter including your view on how your research and/or teaching may fit into the department 2. An up-to-date curriculum vitae including a list of scientific publications 3. A short statement of your research accomplishments and future research goals 4. Sample copies of your research (published papers or papers under review) 5. Names and contact details of two academic references. Unsolicited marketing is not appreciated. 72 months University of Groningen Faculty of Behavioural and Social Sciences Since its foundation in 1614, the University of Groningen has enjoyed an international reputation as a dynamic and innovative center of higher education offering high-quality teaching and research. Balanced study and career paths in a wide variety of disciplines encourage the 30,000 students and researchers to develop their own individual talents. Belonging to the best research universities in Europe and joining forces with prestigious partner universities and networks, the University of Groningen is truly an international place of knowledge. The Faculty of Behavioural and Social Sciences is a center of knowledge focusing on individuals and society. The faculty studies issues relating to human behaviour, the relationships between people, and society as a whole. This includes the study of how people function under normal circumstances, but also of the problems encountered by individuals or groups, and how these can be resolved or prevented. Prof. R.J. Bosker, +31 50 3636631 (secr.)

2017 年 4 月 1 日 申请截止日期︰ 2016 年 11 月 1 日

博士职位在国际博士生学院模仿国际博士生学院 (IDK) 模仿单元慕尼黑巴伐利亚占领到精英网络由赞助文学和艺术研究中心进行投标 IDK 提供创新研究结构理论的观点，来审视历史动力学和跨学科接口的文学和艺术。它的目的是在合作领域，从文学、 戏剧、 电影、 音乐和媒体研究、 艺术史博士学位项目，它提供了一个论坛，在有些地方，从所有这些学科与其他学科相比打开研究项目，并能够在关系中使用。联合研究程序遵循关键词摹仿，提供基本的问题其有效性、 影响、 机会、 策略和索赔权以来的反射在当前理论辩论收获新的相关性以及所有的艺术史的开端。摹仿提供攻读博士的研讨会、 讲习班、 讲座和大师班，以及在文化部门的伙伴机构的实习机会。下的详细信息︰ http://www.mimesis-doc.uni-muenchen.de 申请人应具备很好的有好硕士学位 （或同等学历），在所涉及的科目之一。博士学位项目必须有明确的参考 （即对课题的模仿） 大学的研究程序。将职位 2 年与延长的可能性增加一年。慕尼黑是一个居住的地方。注射用药者的工作语言为德语和英语;都到主学术上适当水平。请在线︰ 接触和在查询︰
